She declares that seeing her sons progress is most important to her. Consequently she always wants to earn more income so they can get a better education. She wants her sons to go to the university and study to become professionals with their own businesses. For this reason she works harder day after day.

Luz Marina has been sewing for third parties for 12 years, thanks to a friend who taught her the business and facilitated her getting her first sewing machine. Currently, Luz Marina continues in the same business and also receives very good orders from her clients, however they do not always pay her on time.

Currently, Luz Marina needs to buy sewing supplies such as fabric, thread and needles among other items but does not have sufficient capital to be able to obtain them. Consequently she is looking forward to a loan that will enable her to buy the materials she needs so she can continue working and generating the necessary income to support her two sons.

Luz Marina expects that her sales will increase and with the extra income she will be able to save so that her sons will have the possibility of acquiring a good education that prepares them for well-paying work in the future.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies such as fabric, thread and needles among other items.

loans.name: Amaan's Group

texts.en:
Amaan is 22 years old, married, and has two children. Both of them are very young and haven’t started their education yet.

Her husband is a salesman, while her brother-in-law also lives with Amaan and her family and works as a salesman, too.

Amaan supports her husband financially by selling salt. She purchases salt at wholesale prices and sells to different grocery stores and general stores in her community.

She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for the further improvement of her business. With the loan investment, she will buy salt in larger quantity. That will allow her to fulfill the clients’ demands and increase her profits and sales.

She is an experienced person in her business and has a good number of business contacts. She is confident that her business will be improved further by investing the loan into it.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Amaan.

loans.use: to buy salt in bulk quantity for selling at a profit.

loans.name: Jamila's Group

texts.en:
Jamila is a very efficient lady and supports her family by sewing clothes for her neighboring clients. She is very fair in her dealings and shows great passion for her business. Due to her good quality work, she receives regular orders every month.

Her husband sells vegetables. He believes in providing good quality, fresh vegetables to his customers for very reasonable rates.

Jamila has given birth to three daughters. Her eldest daughter also sews clothes, while the other two remain at home and help Jamila in doing her household tasks.

She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan investment, he will buy fresh seasonal vegetables for selling to his clients and increase his sales and profits.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah passbook) is Jamila.

loans.use: to buy fresh seasonal vegetables for her husband's vegetable selling business.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en: Halima is a 24-year-old married woman. She has 2 children between 2 and 4 years old. She describes herself to be honest and respectful. She operates a food stall where she sells french fries. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located at a viable area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of potatoes. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more potatoes for making french fries to sell. Halima's business goal is to run a restaurant within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more potatoes for preparing french fries to sell.

loans.name: Gnel

texts.en: Gnel is a 50-year-old farmer who lives with his wife in the village of Vernashen. He works as a veterinarian and his wife works at the local village hall. Gnel also runs a farm where he keeps beehives, cows and sheep. He has applied for this loan to expand his herd of livestock by buying a new cow. This will allow him to develop his farm and increase his income.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

location.town: Vernashen village of Vayots Dzor region

loans.name: Begenj

texts.ru: Бегенч житель района Джиликул. Ему 30 лет. Он женат. У нее четверо детей. Бегенч имеет среднее образование. Он занимается выращиванием овощей и посевом зерновых культур. Кроме того он занимается садоводством. В этой области он 14 лет. Кредит берет для посева пшеницы.
texts.en: Begenj is a resident of the Jilikul district.  He is 30 years old, married and has four children.  Begenj has a secondary education.  He is involved in growing vegetables and sowing cereal crops.  Besides this, he is also involved in gardening.  Begenj has been in this business for 14 years.  He is requesting this loan to sow wheat.

loans.use: to sow wheat

loans.name: Khudaguli

texts.ru: Худагули проживает в районе Джиликул. Ему 40 лет. Он женат. У него двое детей. Он занимается садоводством. Этим видом деятельности занимается 24 года. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Khudaguli lives in the Jilikul district.  He is 40 years old, married and has two children.  He is involved in gardening.  Khudaguli has been in this business for 24 years.  He is requesting this loan to buy mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 34 years old, married, and has two children. She runs a retail shop to earn a living. She has been in the business for five years. She earns extra income from her farming activities. 

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save her income and hopes to be financially stable in the future. She has applied for 70,000 Kenya Shillings to buy sugar, maize flour, and wheat flour.

loans.use: to buy sugar, maize flour, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en: Marie is 29 years old and has earned an income for the last four years by running a beauty salon. She now employs two people and has joined Faulu Kenya as a way to increase her income and be more financially stable in the future. She is applying for a loan for 22,500 Kenyan Shillings to buy a new hair dryer to use in her shop.

loans.use: to buy a new hair dryer to use in her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy maize and loaves of bread.

loans.name: Lan

texts.en: Lan earns a living by making clothing while her husband Phal teaches in a local university. They have been married since 2001 and have three young children -- two sons and one daughter. They live in a suburb that is located about 25 kilometers outside of Phnom Penh.  Lan has applied for a loan for $800 so that her husband can buy a laptop computer to use when preparing documents and lesson plans.

loans.use: to buy a laptop computer for her husband.

loans.name: Rukhsana's Group

texts.en: Rukhsana is 47 years old, married and has five children, all of whom work and help support their family. She is a widow who earns a living by selling clothes which she buys in a wholesale market. She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah to expand her business by buying a better variety of clothing to sell to her customers. She has been in this line of work for many years and is confident of her ability to put this loan to good use. In the photo, she is the person holding the book.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Khurshed

texts.ru: Хуршед целеустремленный и трудолюбивый человек. Он женат и имеет четверых детей. Жена занимается домохозяйством. Хуршед предоставляет услуги транспорта, то есть занимается перевозкой грузов и пассажиров. В этом бизнесе он уже более 8 лет. Кроме того занимается скотоводством и выращиванием сельхозпродукций, такие как, картофель и пшеница. В данном бизнесе ему помогает супруга и сын. Хуршед запрашивает займ для капитального ремонта транспорта, а также покупки запчастей для автомашины.
texts.en: Khurshed is a goal-oriented and hardworking person.  He is married and has four children.  His wife is involved in household work.  Khurshed provides a transportation service, i.e. transporting loads and passengers.  He has been in this business for over eight years.  Besides this, he is involved in animal husbandry and growing agricultural crops, such as potatoes and wheat.  His wife and son help him with this business.  Khurshed is requesting a loan for a major repair of his vehicle and a purchase of spare parts for his car.

loans.use: to repair his car

loans.name: Aligulu

texts.en:
Aligulu has been working as a taxi driver for six years. He is married and has one 2-year-old child. He started a taxi driving service with an old car that he bought for 400 AZN and in the future he plans to buy a new car. 

Aligulu is trying to build a new house for his family, but he can’t afford new materials because he has to pay rent on his apartment. He needs 1,000 AZN to buy construction materials to build his house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to build his house.

loans.name: Nem

texts.en:
Nem makes Onsorm and sells it in the market about 10 kilometers from her house. Onsorm is a kind of Cambodian cake that has rice, coconut, soybean and pork in the middle, and is cooked by steaming.

Nem also assists with her husband’s business when she is free. Her husband is a rice farmer. She is asking for a loan of 1,000 USD to buy a new water-pumping machine, as well as seed, fertilizer, pesticide, and a pesticide applicator.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Sreyneang

texts.en:
Sreyneang, age 45, sells steamed corn in her village. Her husband, Chantha, is a motor taxi driver. They have been married since 1985 and have three children: one son and two daughters. One is married and lives outside the family home. The other two are garment workers. They live in a village about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sreyneang is asking for her first loan of 600 USD to buy a motorcycle for her daughter to get work.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for her daughter to get work.

loans.name: Felister

texts.en: Felister is 21 years old and she sells blouses and sweaters to earn a living. She has been in this business for 2 years and employs one person. Felister earns extra income from her salon business. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Felister has been able to save her income. She hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for a loan of 10,000 Kenya Shillings (KES) to buy blouses and sweaters to sell.

loans.use: To buy blouses and sweaters to sell

loans.name: Vrezh

texts.en: Vrezh, 57 years old, lives with his wife, son, daughter-in-law and grandchild. He is engaged in agriculture; he keeps cattle and cultivates land. Since agriculture is the main source of income for Vrezh's family, he plans to develop his farm and increase his income. With the help of this loan, he plans to purchase cattle and forage. This will help him to get additional income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for cattle and forage

loans.name: C10021 Twitezimbere Group

texts.en:
Emerthe, 42 years old, is married and has six children aged between 4 and 17 years old. She operates a well-organized business selling rice, working from 8 a.m. until 5 p.m. every day. Emerthe is the leader of this group which is called C10021 TWITEZIMBERE (TO BE DEVELOPED) in the local language. She has two years of experience and she currently employs two people to help her.

Emerthe has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her agriculture business buy buying more fertilizer to grow her rice field. She will use any profit generated from this loan to pay her children's school fees and to buy medical insurance for her family.

In the photo, Emerthe is raising her hand.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer to grow her rice field

loans.name: Sheema's Group

texts.en:
Sheema has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her grocery store business, which she started after her husband's death a few years ago. She is now well known among her community clients for her good quality services and products. Sheema will use this loan to buy grocery items such as salt, spices, cooking oils, breads, etc. in larger quantities that will allow her to fulfill her clients' needs and increase her sales and profits.

Sheema is the mother of a son who is married and is a laborer. She is confident that a loan investment will help her become more established in her business and that her family will be able to live better financially as a result.

Note: In the photo, Sheema is holding a book (the Asasah Passbook).

loans.use: To buy spices, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Duo Princesas Group

texts.es: Duo Princesas, Este Duo esta integrado por dos personas de las cuales esta doña Olga Elizabeth Quien se dedica a la venta de prensa y desayunos,jugos de naranja,en la comunidad de santa lucia donde ella tiene ya barios años de dedicarse a esta actividad,ella nos cuenta que la venta de jugos de naranja lo inplemento hace dos años puesto que la señora que vendia jugos dejo de venderlos entonces decidio vender ella y gracias a Dios le a Hido bien,y nos cuenta que el credito anterior le ayudo mucho,y esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mas mercaderia para seguir con su negocio,agradese a fape y Kiva por la ayuda brindad en los creditos,de igual manera doña Maria Juana se dedica a la siembra de ajotes,y a otros cultivos,tambien ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de abono para su cultivo.
texts.en:
Duo Princesas [Princess Duo] is made up of two people, one of whom is Olga Elizabeth, who sells newspapers, breakfast foods and orange juice in the community of Santa Lucia where she has been selling her products for a number of years.  She tells us that she started her orange juice sales two years ago when the woman who had previously been selling it stopped and Olga decided to sell; and thank God it has been going well. She also tells us that the previous loan has been a great help and that she is requesting this loan to buy more merchandise in order to further her business.  She is grateful to FAPE [Foundation for the Assistance of Small Businesses] and Kiva for giving her the help through these loans. 

Similarly, Maria Juana cultivates green beans and other crops.  She is also asking for a loan in order to buy fertilizer for her crops.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and supplies in order to sell products such as oranges, newspapers and ingredients for prepared foods.

loans.name: Huweida

texts.en: Huweida, 31 years old, is married and has a son, 3 years old. She describes herself as a go-getter and an honest woman. She has operated a food stall for 2 years. Her business is located in a strategic area and her primary customers are local residents.  In addition, Huweida sells charcoal to increase her income. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of transportation when delivering food to customers. Huweida will use this KES 20,000 loan to purchase more beans, maize and other ingredients to prepare food. Huweida's business goal is to venture into the gas selling wholesale business within 5 years.

loans.use: to purchase more beans, maize and other ingredients

loans.name: Racheal

texts.en: Racheal is a businesswoman who runs a retail shop to earn a living. She has been in the business for 3 years and employs one person. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Racheal has been able to save her income. She hopes to expand her business in the future. Racheal has applied for a loan of KES 15,000 to buy sodas and maize flour to sell.

loans.use: To buy sodas and maize flour to sell

loans.name: Gevorg

texts.en: Gevorg is a 26-year-old entrepreneur from Armavir. He runs a little restaurant in the city. Gevorg has applied for this loan to develop his business. With the loan's help, he plans to expand the restaurant and purchase food. This will help Gevorg to increase the quality of services for his clients and attract new ones. Gevorg will make his business more profitable and develop it further in the future.

loans.use: to expand the restaurant and purchase food

loans.name: Magalis Isabel

texts.es: Maglys de 58 años de edad, madre de 6 hijos en las edades de 26 a 38 años, es la propietaria de un restaurante, que le ha generado los ingresos suficientes para sostener su hogar. Ella inició hace 25 años, con una sencilla venta de sopas y arroz, la que gradualmente fue creciendo con su trabajo persistente y hace 3 años la llevó a pasar de un incipiente negocio a tener  su propio restaurante, donde vende desayunos, almuerzos y comidas; así mismo adicionó hace poco, masa de maíz que vende a microempresas de fritos y galletas procedentes del Carmen de Bolívar, estas últimas con una gran acogida. Ella vende diariamente y principalmente de contado, maneja también cuentas por cobrar con sus mejores clientes. Su meta de seguir ampliando su negocio es inagotable y esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el que comprará un molino eléctrico, calderos, mesas y sillas, para ampliar su infraestructura, de acuerdo con su creciente clientela y ofrecer un ambiente confortable, que cada vez mas atraiga clientes y aumente su rentabilidad, que en la actualidad es no menor del 43% y planea aumentar con cada inyección de capital de trabajo que logre con su credikiva.
texts.en:
Maglys, 58, is the mother of six children whose ages range from 26 to 38.  She owns a restaurant she created 25 years ago and that has generated sufficient income to support her home.  She started out 25 years ago simply selling soups and rice but gradually grew thanks to her persistent work and three years ago managed to create her own restaurant where she sells breakfasts, lunches and dinners.  

A short while ago she also installed corn dough that she sells to micro firms from Carmen de Bolívar that make fried snacks and crackers that are highly sought after.  She sells every day and mainly for cash although she does manage a few credit accounts for her best customers.  Her goal is to continue expanding her business.  

She is tireless and this is why she’s calling on her Kiva loan, the first financing she’s gotten from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, that she’ll use to buy an electric mill, stew pots, tables and chairs to expand her infrastructure according to her growing clientele to offer a comfortable environment that will attract more customers each time and increase its profitability which is currently 43% planning to increase it with each injection of working capital from her Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy an electric mill, tables, chairs and stew pots.

loans.name: 2012 Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “2012” está conformado por 17 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran preparación de tortas, banquetería, venta de verduras, venta de perfumes, venta de ropa, relojería, podología, entre otros negocios. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Chillán.
Alejandra presidenta del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra en la primera fila, en el segundo lugar de derecha a izquierda, viste una blusa estampada con colores negro y fucsia, además de unos pantalones ajustados hasta la rodilla color negro. Su cabello es largo y liso, de color castaño oscuro y en su mano derecha sostiene un sobre blanco.
Ella se dedica a vender ropa de dama adulta y joven. Se desempeña en este negocio desde hace 7 años, comenzó vendiendo ropa usada y actualmente se dedica a vender solo ropa nueva.
Comenta que cuenta con un gran número de clientes, en su mayoría nueva. Sus ventas las realiza puerta a puerta y también por internet.
Su mercadería la compra por internet y se la despachan por encomienda.
Con el crédito comprará ropa de dama.
Una de las metas en su negocio es tener un local establecido y asociarse con una de sus amigas.
Alejandra vive junto a su marido y sus tres hijos de 8, 3 y 1 año de edad. Sus sueños son obtener su casa propia, para esto ya se encuentra ahorrando y ya postuló al subsidio habitacional. Sus motivaciones de continuar con el negocio, son ayudar económicamente a su familia, para brindarle una mejor calidad de vida.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Comenta que el grupo del Banco comunal del cual forma parte es muy responsable y ameno. Respecto a las capacitaciones, estas le han servido para organizar la contabilidad de su negocio.
La foto que aparece en el recuedro es una integrante del Banco comunal que por problemas personales no pudo asistir el día de la toma de foto grupal.
Chillán es una comuna de la zona centro sur de Chile. Su nombre significa “silla del sol” en mapudungun, idioma de nuestros indígenas mapuches. Chillán es conocida como “Cuna de la Patria” o “Tierra de Artistas”, debido a que en la ciudad han nacido destacados personajes de la historia de Chile, como por ejemplo el conocido pianista Claudio Arrau.
texts.en:
This community bank is called “2012”.  It is made up of 17 entrepreneurs who work in different fields including, cake making, catering services, vegetable sales, perfume sales, clothing sales, watchmaking, podiatry (chiropody), etc.  All of the bank's members live in the city of Chillán.

Alejandra is the president of the community bank.  In the photo she can be found in the front row, second from the right.  She is wearing a printed blouse which is black and fuchsia.  She is also wearing black, knee-length pants.  She has long, straight, dark brown hair.  In her right hand she is holding a white envelope.

Alejandra's business is selling ladies' and girls' clothing.  She has been working in this business for seven years.  She started out selling used clothing but now she only sells new clothing.

Alejandra comments that she has a large number of customers who are mainly new.  She makes her sales door to door and also over the Internet.  She buys her merchandise on the Internet and they post it to her.  She will use her loan to buy ladies' clothing. One of her business goals is to have sales premises and to go into business with one of her friends.

Alejandra lives together with her husband and her three children who are 8, 3 and 1 year old.  Her dream is to own her own home and so she is saving up and has already applied for housing subsidy.  Her motivation to continue in her business is that she wants to help her family financially so that she can provide them with a better quality of life.

Alejandra is very happy and grateful for the opportunity she has received from Fondo Esperanza as it will allow her to invest in her business.  She says that the members of her community bank are very responsible and nice people.  The training sessions have helped her to organize her business accounts. The small photo that appears is a member of the communal bank who could not attend the meeting for the group photo due to personal problems. 

Chillán is a town in Chile's central-southern zone.  Its name means 'chair of the sun' in Mapundungun, the language of our indigenous Mapuche people.  Chilllán is known as "Birthplace of the Motherland" or "Land of Artists" as it has been the birthplace of prominent figures from Chile's history such as, for example, the well-known pianist Claudio Arrau.

loans.use: to buy ladies' clothing

loans.name: Lourdes Monserrate

texts.es:
En el sitio Santa Martha de la  parroquia Riochico en Portoviejo,  cada quince días se  reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Querer Es Poder De Riochico. Este lugar se lo conoce por su  vegetación donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura.

En este lugar vive la señora Lourdes, tiene 40 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de  18, 15 y 11 años de edad, los mismos que estudian en colegio y la menor en escuela. El marido es agricultor.
 
Ella es una gran madre y ama de casa que  para ayudar a su esposo a salir adelante se dedica al comercio, vende productos de Avon, (productos de belleza, perfumería y accesorios de damas), su forma de venta es puerta a puerta aunque la mayor parte de sus ventas las realiza en su casa ya que varias de sus clientes la visitan en su hogar,  deja a crédito y cobra semanalmente, lleva más de 6 años dedicada a esta actividad y  lo mas vende son los perfumes y las cremas.

Este crédito es para comprar más perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y bisutería. Lleva en el Banco Comunal tres ciclos, es la secretaria del grupo  y le gusta porque el grupo es muy unido.
 
Sus sueños son seguir adelante en su negocio y su vida familiar.
texts.en:
The members of the "Querer es Poder de Riochico" communal bank meet every two weeks in Santa Martha, in Riochico parish, in Portoviejo. This place is known for its vegetation. and the majority of its inhabitants work in agriculture.

This is the place where Lourdes lives. She is 40, in a common-law relationship, and has three children ages 18, 15, and 11. The youngest is in school, and the others in high school. Her husband is a farmer. She is a great mother and housewife, who has a small business in order to help her husband get ahead.

She sells Avon products, (beauty products, perfume, and women's accessories). She sells door to door, although the greater part of her sales are carried out in her home, as several of her customers visit her at home. 

This loan is in order to buy more perfume, creams, cosmetics, and costume jewelry. She has been in the communal bank for three loan cycles, and is the group's secretary. She likes it because the group is very close-knit. Her dream is to move forward with her business and family life.

loans.use: To buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Rita Del Carmen

texts.es:
Rita del Carmen tiene 42 años de edad es casada tiene tres hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos en el cantón ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Es integranbte de la VRC 27 DE OCTUBR, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Santa Sofía, Perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, Esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol gandul.

Rita se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y frejol gandúl. Las compras y las ventas lo ahace en ventanas. 

Solicita el crédito para  comprar semillas, fertilizantes, urea, líquidos.Con la ayuda del crédito podra comprar los abonos agricolas para poder trabajar en la agricultura. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas.

El sueño es poder tener casa propia y terrenos. en el tiempo libre le gusta realizar los quehaceres domésticos.
texts.en:
Rita del Carmen is 42 years old and married with three children.  She lives with her husband and children in the canton of Ventanas in the Los Rios province.  She is a member of the communal bank 27 de Octubre, which is located in the Santa Sofia precinct in the Ventanas canton.  This solidarity group earns their living through short-rotation farming of corn, rice and pigeon pea beans.   

Rita makes a living in agriculture cultivating corn and pigeon pea beans. She makes her purchases and sales in Ventanas. Rita is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, urea [an organic compound used with fertilizer] and liquids.  With the help of a loan, she will be able to buy compost in order to work in the agricultural sector. The challenges she faces are pests.  

Her dream is to be able to own a house with land and in her free time she likes to do housework.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, urea and liquids.

loans.name: Faysuli

texts.es:
Emprendedora es la mejor palabra con la que se puede reconocer a Faysuli, una joven de 20 años que siempre ha querido generar sus propios ingresos y colaborar con los gastos de su hogar. Faysuli desde muy temprana edad empezó a mostrar que era una persona llena de ideas que quería formar una empresa y generar unos ingresos para su hogar. Actualmente, Faysuli se dedica a la producción y venta de bolis (congelada), actividad que emprendió ella sola y que aprendió gracias a que trabajaba en una empresa que se dedicaba a esta actividad, pero su trabajo era muy mal remunerado por lo que decidió empezar con su propio negocio. 
Faysuli actualmente tiene muy buenas ventas en su negocio gracias a que sus productos son de muy buena calidad y su servicio siempre es el mejor. Sin embargo, Faysuli presenta un inconveniente a la hora de producir sus productos, pues toda la producción la hace manual y sus herramientas no son las mejores, lo que hace que no pueda atender pedidos muy grandes ni tampoco pueda automatizar los procesos. Es por esto que Faysuli requiere de la compra de una máquina selladora que le permita sellar los bolis (congelados) luego de haber sido envasado su contenido, y también de un enfriador que le permita contener sus productos bajo las condiciones que se requieren, sin embargo, Faysuli actualmente no cuenta con el capital suficiente para la compra de estos productos, por lo que aspira a que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de la máquina selladora y el enfriador, de modo que pueda seguir produciendo sus productos con una mayor calidad.
Faysuli espera que sus productos al salir con una mejor calidad estos aumenten sus ventas, y así podrá cumplir su sueño de tener una gran fábrica y poder generar empleo para las personas más necesitadas.
texts.en:
Enterprising is the best word to describe Faysuli, a young 20-year-old who has always wanted to generate her own income and pay her share of household expenses. From a very early age, Faysuli began to demonstrate that she was a person full of ideas, who wanted to form a company and generate some income for her home. At present, Faysuli is producing and selling 'bolis' (frozen pops), an activity she began on her own and learned, thanks to working in an enterprise that did this. Her work was very poorly remunerated and she decided to start her own business. 

At present, Faysuli's business enjoys good sales, thanks to the fact that her products are of very good quality and her service is always the best. Nevertheless, Faysuli faces inconvenience when producing her products because the work is done manually and her equipment is not the best. The result is that she can not fill large orders, nor can she automate the process. For this reason, Faysuli needs to buy a sealant machine that will permit her, after filling the tubes, to seal the frozen 'bolis', and also, a cooler to allow her products to be kept under the required conditions. Unfortunately, currently, Faysuli lacks sufficient capital to purchase this equipment, and for that reason, she is requesting a loan to make it possible to buy a sealant machine and a cooler, so she can produce products of even greater quality.

Faysuli hopes that by improving the quality of her products, sales will grow and thus, she will achieve her dream: to have a large factory someday, generating jobs for people in need.

loans.use: to buy a sealant machine and a cooler for the production of the "bolis" (frozen pops) she makes and sells.

loans.name: Blanca Nury

texts.es:
Blanca es una persona muy trabajadora y dedicada a sus 2 hijos, a quienes siempre les quiere brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Blanca es una madre soltera cabeza de familia, pues su esposo los abandonó hace un tiempo.	
Desde hace aproximadamente 15 años, Blanca se dedica a la venta de productos como alimentos, y también accesorios a las afuera de un colegio, y gracias a esto le ha podido brindar a sus hijos todo lo que han necesitado, sin embargo, sus ingresos no son muy altos, por lo que tan solo cubre las necesidades básicas de sus hijos.
Blanca espera que sus ingresos puedan aumentar, de modo que les pueda mejorar la calidad de vida actual a sus hijos, y les permita acceder a una mejor educación.
Blanca espera que con el inicio de la temporada escolar sus ventas aumenten significativamente, por lo que requiere de la compra de mercancía para afrontar esta temporada, sin embargo, Blanca no cuenta actualmente con el capital necesario para ello, por lo que aspira a que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de mercancía como accesorios para niño y niña y pueda afrontar con un buen inventario el inicio de la temporada escolar.
Blanca sueña con que sus ingresos aumenten para poder ofrecerles a sus hijos una mejor educación y en un futuro acceder a una educación universitaria que les permita obtener un empleo bien remunerado. Además, sueña con poder montar un almacén donde pueda vender muchas más mercancía que la que vende actualmente y pueda generar mucho empleo para contratar a personas muy necesitadas.
texts.en:
Blanca is a very hard-working person who is dedicated to her two children, to whom she always wants to provide a better quality of life. Blanca is a single mother and is the head of the household, since her husband left them some time ago.

For approximately 15 years, Blanca has sold products such as food, and also accessories, outside of a school. Thanks to this, she has been able to provide her children with everything they have needed; nevertheless, her income is not very high, so it only covers her children's basic needs.

Blanca hopes that her income will increase so that it will improve her children's current quality of life and allow them to obtain a better education.

Blanca hopes that with the start of the school year her income will increase significantly. For this, she needs to purchase merchandise in order to face this season. However, Blanca does not currently have sufficient capital for that, so she is hoping that a loan will provide her with the possibility of being able to purchase merchandise such as accessories for boys and girls, and that she will be able to face the back-to-school season with a good inventory.

Blanca dreams of her income increasing so that she can offer her children a better education, and that in the future they will go on to a university education that will permit them to obtain a well-paying job. Also, she dreams of being able to build a store where she could sell much more merchandise than she sells now and could create many jobs in order to hire very needy people.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise, namely accessories for boys and girls, to face the back-to-school season

loans.name: Gloria Stella

texts.es:
Gloria ha sido una persona que le ha tocado trabajar desde muy corta edad. A sus 20 años ya se ha desempeñado en diferentes labores, y desde hace 6 años de ha dedicado al reciclaje, comprando cajas de cartón a un supermercado de su sector, y luego vendiéndolas al reciclaje. Gloria hace esto con el ánimo de poderle mejorar la calidad de vida a sus padres, pues son personas que también se han visto en la obligación de trabajar durante gran parte de sus vidas, y no han podido progresar como han querido debido a diferentes adversidades que se les han presentado en el camino.
Gloria espera que su negocio pueda seguir creciendo, pues conoce la persona que le vende las cajas en el supermercado y la competencia no es muy grande, por lo que su negocio le augura un buen futuro. Además Gloria espera que cuando su negocio le genere mayores ingresos, pueda montar un almacén y poder realizar ventas superiores a las actuales, de modo que le genere mayores ingresos y pueda ayudar a sus padres a mejorar las condiciones en las que viven actualmente. 
Con el ánimo de aprovechar los precios bajos de la temporada que le está ofreciendo el supermercado por la compra de las cajas, Gloria aspira a comprar una gran cantidad de ellas, sin embargo, actualmente no cuenta con el capital suficiente para ello. Es por esto que Gloria aspira a que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de cajas de cartón en una gran cantidad y poder venderlas con un margen de ganancia más amplio. 
Gloria sueña con que sus padres puedan tener una mejor calidad de vida, y puedan descansar de lo mucho que han trabajado.
texts.en:
Gloria is a woman whose lot in life has been to work from a very young age.  At the age of twenty she’s already had various jobs.  For the last six years she’s been working in recycling buying cardboard boxes at a local supermarket and then reselling them to recyclers.  Gloria does all this in order to improve her parents’ quality of life; they have been unable to make progress like they’ve wished to due to various adversities that have arisen along the way.

Gloria hopes that her business will be able to continue growing since she knows the person at the supermarket that sells her the boxes and competition isn’t too great so her business has a good future.  Besides, Gloria hopes that when her business generates higher income she’ll be able to open a warehouse so that her sales can be better than they currently are and she can generate higher income to help her parents improve their current living conditions.

Hoping to take advantage of lower seasonal prices the supermarket is offering to purchase the boxes, Gloria hopes to buy a large amount of them.  However, she does not have capital to do so at present.  This is why Gloria hopes for a loan that will make it possible for her to buy the cardboard boxes in large amounts so that she can sell them with a better profit margin.

Gloria dreams with her parents being able to have better quality of life so that they can rest after all their hard work.

loans.use: to buy cardboard boxes in quantity.

loans.name: Zarina's Group

texts.en:
Zarina has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her husband’s vegetable-selling business. He operates his business in a vegetable market and provides fresh quality vegetables to his customers for low rates.

Zarina remains at home and does her household responsibilities. She is very active and performs her tasks very well. She has two sons and two daughters. Three of her children are studying while her youngest daughter is not of school-going age yet.

Zarina is hopeful that by purchasing fresh seasonal vegetables with this loan, her husband will successfully improve his business and she will send her youngest daughter to school next year.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for vegetable-selling business.

loans.name: Lizbeth

texts.es:
La señorita Lizbeth  tiene veinte años de edad se dedica a la venta de plátanos  desde hace  un año.
Ella nos cuenta  que  también vende plátanos fritos con lechera, sale a vender en  las colonias de s u localidad.
Lo que mas le gusta de su negocio es  que le dedica el tiempo  que  desee ya que ayuda a su mama en los  quehaceres de  la casa.
Ella pidió el préstamo para la compra de más plátanos para la venta.
texts.en:
Lizbeth is 20, and has been selling bananas for a year. She tells us that she also sells fried bananas with sweetened condensed milk. She goes out to sell in the local neighborhoods.  

What she likes best about her business is that she devotes the time she wants to it, because she helps her mother with the household chores. She asked for the loan in order to buy more bananas to sell.

loans.use: To buy bananas to sell.

loans.name: Andres

texts.es:
Andrés se ha caracterizado por ser una persona con un gran carisma y con una gran dedicación a su trabajo y su familia. Desde hace ya 7 años se tuvo que enfrentar a la adversidad de quedarse sin empleo y tener que rebuscarse su sustento de manera independiente. Es por esto que montó su propio negocio, y gracias a este puede generar los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hogar donde convive con su esposa y sus 4 hijos. Andrés, actualmente sigue trabajando en su propio negocio y siempre se esfuerza para que salga adelante y siga creciendo para poder mejorarles la calidad de vida a las personas de su familia. Debido a problemas de orden público, Andrés ha visto como su negocio sufre las consecuencias de la violencia, pues a veces es extorsionado por los delincuentes y esto hace que sus ingresos no sean los mejores. Con el ánimo de afrontar la temporada escolar que está por comenzar, Andrés quiere surtir su negocio con mercancía de papelería, sin embargo, actualmente no cuenta con el capital suficiente para ello, por lo que aspira a que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de productos de papelería como son cuadernos, cartulinas, lapiceros, borradores, entre otros, y pueda así seguir generando los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su familia. 
Andrés sueña con que su negocio crezca y le genere los ingresos suficientes para brindarles a sus hijos la posibilidad de acceder a una buena educación y a una educación universitaria, de modo que en un futuro puedan acceder a un buen empleo y bien remunerado.
texts.en:
Andrés has been noted for being a person with great charisma and dedication to work and family.  Seven years ago he had to face the adversity of becoming unemployed and having to find a new source of independent support.  Because of this, he opened his own business and thanks to it is able to generate the income necessary to support his home where he lives with his wife and four children.

Andrés is currently working in his own business and he always strives to get ahead and to continue growing to improve the quality of life for people in is family.  Because of problems with public order, Andrés has seen his business suffer the consequences of violence because he’s sometimes been extorted by delinquents and this causes his income to be less than it could be.

Hoping to face the school term that is about to start, Andrés wants to stock his store with stationery supplies.  However, he does not have enough capital at present to do so which is why he’s hoping for a loan that will make it possible for him to buy the stationery items like notebooks, construction paper, pencils and erasers, among others, to continue generating the income needed to support his family.

Andrés dreams with his business growing and generating sufficient income to provide his children with the possibility of accessing a good education and a university education so that in future they will be able to access a good, well-paid job.

loans.use: to buy stationery supplies like notebooks, construction paper, pencils and erasers, among others.

loans.name: Reuben

texts.en:
Reuben is a father of two children. He runs a mobile repair shop to earn a living and has been in the business for 2 years. He describes his business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. 

Since Reuben joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his income and hopes to be financially stable in the future. He has applied for a loan of 20,000 Kenya Shillings (KES) to buy spare parts for mobile phones.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for mobile phones.

loans.name: Paskal

texts.en:
Paskal is a farmer in Kitale with over 20 years of experience in farming. His farm currently produces maize, beans, and vegetables for the local market.

Paskal has requested for a loan of 41,600 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He wants to venture into dairy farming specifically to earn income for family upkeep and to repay the loan. He hopes to grow his business and establish a dairy breeding farm for the local farmers.

Paskal says poor roads and animal diseases are the main challenges in the area.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.es:
Eusebio es una persona que siempre ha buscado el bienestar para su esposa. 
Desde hace cerca de 3 años tiene el negocio de su tienda general, y gracias a esta puede generar los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hogar. Eusebio siempre ha querido que su negocio crezca para poder que le genere ingresos mayores a los actuales y pueda brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su esposa, quién siempre lo ha acompañado. 
Eusebio tiene en su tienda los productos necesarios para satisfacer las necesidades de las personas del sector, sin embargo, la competencia ha sido tan fuerte, que Eusebio requiere de la compra de más productos para poder atender a sus clientes con una mayor variedad de productos y hacerse más atractivo para las compras de sus clientes, sin embargo, Eusebio no cuenta en la actualidad con el capital suficiente para comprar el surtido, por lo que aspira a que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de comprar el surtido de víveres para el hogar, elementos de aseo, snacks, entre otros productos.
Eusebio sueña con tener hijos y poderles brindar una buena educación, también tiene el gran sueño de comprar un local para poder montar su negocio, pues actualmente el local es arrendado y esto le genere gastos extras.
texts.en:
Eusebio has always sought his wife’s wellbeing.  For the last three years he’s had a general store that generates the necessary income to support his home.  Eusebio has always wanted his business to grow so that it can generate higher income than presently and he can provide his wife who has always been by his side with a better quality of life.

Eusebio stocks in his store everything needed to meet the needs of people in the sector.  However, competition has become stronger and Eusebio needs to buy more products to tend to his customers with a wider variety of products so that he will be more attractive for their purchases.  However, Eusebio does not have enough capital at present to buy the stock and this is why he hopes for a loan that will make it possible for him to buy a supply of foodstuffs for the home, cleaning supplies and snacks, among others.

Eusebio dreams with having children and with providing them with a good education.  He also dreams with being able to buy a locale to install his store in because he currently rents and this is an extra cost.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for his store.

loans.name: C16005 Abuzuzanya Group

texts.en:
Jeanne is 57 years old and married. She has four children who range in age from 1 to 30 years old and she takes care of six relatives. Her business is well organized.  She sells various goods such as beans, rice, sugar, salt, etc. and works from 5 a.m. until 8 p.m. every day except on Sunday. 

Jeanne is a leader of this group which is called C16005 Abuzuzanya in the local language. She is the third person from the right side in the second row. She has 14 years of experience in her work and she currently employs 12 people to help her.

Jeanne has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase various goods such as beans, rice, sugar, salt, etc. to sell. With any profit, she will pay her children's school fees, buy medical insurance for her family, save, and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase various goods such as beans, rice, sugar, salt, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Phea

texts.en:
Phea, 25, is single and resides with her mother in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for over five years, earning approximately US $3 per day. Her mother has worked in rice farming for over 20 years, earning approximately US $1 per day. 

Due to the lack of cattle to use in her mother’s farming, Phea is requesting for a loan of US $400 to purchase cattle for her mother to use for plowing her farmland, as well as to carry her crops home. In the future, she would to like to learn how to design clothes, to rebuild her present house to be much stronger, and to provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase cattle for her mother to use for plowing her farmland, as well as to carry her crops home.

loans.name: Faustin

texts.en:
Faustin is 33 years old and married. He sells various goods such as juice, water, sugar, cakes, and salt. This is his second year in this business and he works from 9 a.m. until 6 p.m. every day except on Saturday. 

Faustin has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase various goods such as juice, water, sugar, cakes, salt, etc. to sell. With any profits, he will be able to save for his future, reinvest in his business, and build his own house.

loans.use: To purchase various goods such as juice, water, sugar, cakes, salt, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Jose Erasmo

texts.es:
José, vive acompañado de su esposa, tiene dos hijos de 8 y 3 años de edad, él administra un taller de enderezado  y pintura de vehículos, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 4 años, trabaja todos los días desde las 7:00am hasta las 6:00pm.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de lijas, espuma, pintura, y otros materiales para realizar su trabajo de una buena manera, esto le ayudara para brindar un mejor servicio y así tener más trabajo.
La aspiración de José es que sus hijos sientan el apoyo de él, con el taller espera que sea rentable para poder mejorar los ingresos familiares.
texts.en:
José lives with his wife and has three children, ages 8 and 3. He runs a vehicle paint and body shop. He has had this business for four years, and works every day from 7:00am to 6:00pm. 

Now he is applying for a loan to buy sandpaper, foam, paint, and other materials for carrying out his work properly. This will help him offer better service, and so have more work.  

José's ambition is for his children to feel supported by him. As for the workshop, he hopes that it will be profitable, so that he can improve the family income.

loans.use: To buy sandpaper, foam, and paint.

loans.name: Maria Ligia

texts.es:
Maria Ligia es una persona que ha tenido que pasar por muchas adversidades en su vida. Vive en su hogar con su hija, debido a que el padre de su hija las abandonó hace un tiempo. Maria Ligia siempre ha tenido en su hija una fuente de inspiración, y gracias a esto trabaja todos los días fuertemente con el ánimo de sacarla adelante. Desde entonces, Maria Ligia se ha rebuscado con diferentes actividades el sustento necesario para sostener los gastos de su hogar, y a pesar de que sus ingresos son muy bajos, le alcanza para cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hija. Maria Ligia sueña con que su hija pueda acceder a una buena educación, y en un futuro a una educación universitaria que le permita obtener un empleo bien remunerado.
Maria Ligia actualmente se dedica a la venta de productos como bolis (congelados), gaseosas, cervezas, entre otros productos, y gracias a esto genera los ingresos necesarios. Con el ánimo de que sus ventas aumenten, Maria Ligia requiere de la compra de más mercancía para su negocio, sin embargo, actualmente no cuenta con el capital suficiente para ello. Es por esto que Maria Ligia tiene la esperanza de que un préstamo le permita acceder a la compra de productos como cerveza, gaseosa, licor, entre otros productos para poder seguir ofreciéndoselos a sus clientes y garantizar sus ingresos.
Maria Ligia sueña con algún día poder tener un negocio que le genere unos ingresos estables, y poder contar con un ingreso que le permita cubrir todas las necesidades en su hogar. Maria Ligia le quiere ofrecer a su hija una buena educación, y que en un futuro, no tenga que sufrir las mismas adversidades que ella.
texts.en:
María Ligia is a person who has gone through many adversities in her life.  She lives at home with her daughter because her daughter’s father abandoned her some time ago.  María Ligia’s daughter has always been her source of inspiration and thanks to this she works very hard every day hoping to move her ahead.  Since then, María has looked for different activities to generate support for her household expenses and despite her income being very low it’s enough to cover her daughter’s basic needs.  María Ligia dreams with her daughter being able to access a good education and in future a university education that will allow her to have a well-paying job.

María Ligia currently sells products like “bolis” (frozen treats), soft-drinks and beer, among other products and thanks to this generates the necessary income.  Hoping that her sales will increase, María Ligia needs to buy more merchandise for her business but does not have enough capital at present to do so and this is why María Ligia is hoping for a loan that will allow her to buy such products as beer, soft-drinks and liquor, among others to continue offering to her customers and guaranteeing her income.

María Ligia dreams with one day having a business that generates stable income so that she can count on having income to cover all her household needs.  María Ligia wants to offer her daughter a good education so that in the future she won’t have to go through the same adversities she went through.

loans.use: to buy beer, soft-drinks and liquor, among others.

loans.name: Nan

texts.en:
Nan, 42, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been involved in the agricultural business for over twenty years. They have extensive experience and are successful in their career. They are involved in growing rice and fattening up cattle. Additionally, Nan's husband is a carpenter who manufactures tables, chairs, beds, and other furniture to sell in order to generate more income to financially support the family. Her daughter is a garment worker. 

In order to increase her family’s income, Nan is requesting a loan of 400 USD to purchase more cattle to breed and to sell for a profitable price when they gain weight. In the future, she would like to expand her agricultural business, build a new house, and support her childrens' studies until they get Bachelor's degrees.

Note: Nan's husband is shown in picture.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle to breed and sell for a profitable price when they gain weight.

loans.name: Seak

texts.en:
Seak, 37, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been involved in growing rice for over ten years and are successful in their work. Additionally, her husband has been selling coconuts for over two years to generate more income to support the family, earning approximately US $4 per day. 

In order to improve husband’s business, Seak is requesting a loan of US $375 to purchase a trailer for her husband to carry coconuts in larger quantities to sell. By doing so, her husband will be able to generate extra profit to support the family. In the future, Seak would like to purchase a small truck for her husband to carry coconuts to sell in Phnom Penh city. In addition, she hopes to rebuild her present house to be much stronger, to provide comfortable living conditions for her family, and to support her children to study until they get Bachelor's degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a trailer for her husband to carry coconuts in larger quantities to sell.

loans.name: Pedro José

texts.es:
Emprendedor es la mejor palabra con la que se puede caracterizar a Pedro, una persona que siempre ha sido luchadora y con ganas de salir adelante. 
Pedro, con 42 años, casado y padre de 2 hijos, es una persona reconocida en su sector por tener un gran carisma y por siempre querer colaborarles a las demás personas.
Pedro actualmente se dedica a la producción de maní confitado y de bombones de coco, y gracias a esta actividad es que genera los ingresos necesarios para cubrir las obligaciones de su hogar. En esta actividad lleva aproximadamente 15 años, y gracias a la dedicación por el trabajo que tiene Pedro, su negocio vende los productos a otros municipios cercanos de donde se encuentra la producción.
Pedro actualmente presenta el inconveniente de que el vehículo donde transporta la mercancía hacia los otros municipios se encuentra averiado, pero no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para su reparación. Es por esto que Pedro aspira a que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la reparación del motor de su vehículo para poder así seguir comercializando sus productos, y seguir obteniendo los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hogar. 
Pedro tiene un gran sueño y es el de que sus hijos puedan acceder a una buena educación, y que en un futuro, tengan la oportunidad de ingresar a una educación universitaria que les permita obtener un empleo con una buena remuneración, y que no tengan que pasar por las adversidades que ha tenido que pasar el.
texts.en:
The best word to use to characterize Pedro is entrepreneur; he’s a person who has always been a fighter and determined to get ahead.  Pedro is 42 years old, married and the father of two children.  He’s known in his sector for having great charisma and because he always wants to help out other people.

Pedro currently works making candied peanuts and coconut candies.  Thanks to this activity he’s able to generate the necessary income to cover all his household obligations.  He’s been in this business for about 15 years and thanks to Pedro’s dedication to work his business sells his products in other cities near to where he produces them.

Pedro is currently facing the inconvenience that the vehicle he uses to transport the merchandise to the other towns is in need of repair but he does not have enough money to repair it.  This is why Pedro is hoping for a loan that will make it possible to repair the vehicle’s engine so that he can continue to sell his products and continue to earn income needed to support his home.

Pedro has a great dream: that his children can access a good education so that in the future they will be able to enter the university so that they can have well-paying jobs and not have to go through the adversities he’s had to go through.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle's engine.

loans.name: Yaneth De Jesus

texts.es:
Yaneth es una persona que siempre ha luchado por sacar su familia adelante. Hace un tiempo el padre de sus hijos la abandonó y ella quedó como una madre soltera cabeza de familia a cargo de 2 hijos de 4 y 7 años de edad. Desde entonces Yaneth ha procurado generar los ingresos suficientes para cubrir sus necesidades, sin embargo, los ingresos no han sido los mejores, por tanto solo le ha alcanzado generar los ingresos suficientes como para cubrir vagamente sus necesidades básicas. 
Yaneth se dedica a la venta de productos por catálogo, como lo son desodorantes, lociones, shampoo, cremas de manos, entre otros productos, y gracias a esto genera sus ingresos. Sin embargo, Yaneth quiere diversificar los productos que ofrece a sus clientes, por lo que quiere aumentar la cantidad de productos que ofrece. 
Yaneth quiere comprar productos de papelería que le permitan atender la temporada escolar que esta por iniciar, sin embargo, no cuenta con el capital suficiente para ello, por lo que aspira a que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de los productos de papelería como lo son cuadernos, cartulina, borradores, entre otros.
Yaneth sueña con poder obtener mejores ingresos para poder ofrecerles a sus 2 hijos una buena educación y una estabilidad económica, pues no quiere que ellos afronten todas las adversidades por las que ella ha pasado.
texts.en:
Yaneth is a person who has always fought to move her family ahead.  Some time ago her children’s father abandoned her and she became a single mother head of household in charge of two children who are 4 and 7 years old.  Since then Yaneth has worked to generate income sufficient to meet their needs.  However, income has not been the best so she’s barely been able to meet their most basic needs.

Yaneth sells catalogue products like deodorants, lotions, shampoo and hand creams, among others; thanks to this she generates income.  However, Yaneth wants to diversify the products she offers her customers so wants to increase the amount of products she sells.

Yaneth wants to buy stationery supplies for the upcoming school term that’s about to start but she does not have enough capital to do so.  She is hoping for a loan that will make it possible for her to buy stationery supplies like notebooks, construction paper and erasers, among others.

Yaneth dreams with earning better income to be able to offer her two children a good education and economic stability because she does not want them to have to face the adversities she’s had to.

loans.use: to buy school supplies.

loans.name: Delcira Del Socorro

texts.es:
Delcira es una persona que siempre ha querido ayudar en el sostenimiento del hogar. Delcira convive en su hogar con su esposo y sus 4 hijos, y ellos son la inspiración para que Delcira se esfuerce en su trabajo todos los días. Debido a que los ingresos que recibe su esposo por el trabajo son muy bajos, Delcira decidió empezar a trabajar para poder ayudar a contribuir con los gastos de su hogar, para poder mejorar la calidad de vida de sus 4 hijos y su esposo.
Es por esto que Delcira inició la actividad de vender mercancía por catálogo a sus amigos y familiares, y adicionalmente a esto decidió montar un pequeño salón de belleza que le permita generar ingresos adicionales.
Debido a que en pocos días inicia la temporada escolar en su región, Delcira tiene pedidos de sus clientes para comprar sudaderas, sin embargo, no tiene el dinero suficiente para poder hacerle el pedido a su proveedor. 
Es por esto que Delcira espera que un préstamo le permita acceder a la compra de sudaderas para satisfacer los pedidos de sus clientes, y poder seguir obteniendo ingresos para el sostenimiento de su hogar.
Delcira tiene un gran sueño y es el de que sus hijos puedan tener una buena educación y una buena calidad de vida. Además, siempre se ha soñado con poder comprar su casa propia, donde sus hijos puedan crecer tranquilamente y poder acceder a mejores beneficios.
texts.en:
Delcira is a person who has always wanted to help support her household.  Delcira lives at home with her husband and four children who are Delcira’s inspiration to work every day.  Because her husband’s income is very low, Delcira started to work to help contribute toward household expenses and to improve her husband’s and her four children’s quality of life. Because of this, Delcira started selling merchandise via catalogue to her friends and family and she also set up a small beauty salon to earn additional income.

Because the new school term in her region is about to start, Delcira has pending customer orders for sweatshirts but she does not have enough money to place the order with her supplier.  Because of this, Delcira hopes for a loan that will make it possible for her to buy the sweatshirts to fill customer orders and continue earning income for her home’s support.

Delcira has a great dream which is that her children can have a good education and a good quality of life.  She’s also always dreamt with buying a house of her own where her children can grow up in peace and to be able to access better benefits.

loans.use: to buy sweatshirts.

loans.name: Timoteo

texts.es:
Timoteo, de 52 años de edad, es originario de La Isla Ometepe, Granada, se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de carga desde 27 años. Esta casado, tiene dos hijos. Inicio con esta actividad cuando viajo por primer vez  desde su isla a la ciudad de Granada y vio el movimiento comercial que es muy bueno pues Granada es una de la ciudades mas turísticas y con afluencia de extranjeros muy constante , en ese entonces su esposa estaba embarazada de su primer hijo  y decidió vender su terreno que tenia en la isla y venirse a vivir a Granada donde compro una casa sencilla pero con la fe y la esperanza de ir la mejorando poco a poco, el se dedicaba a ser capitán de puerto ,estableció su negocio cuando hizo un primer préstamo y compro un camión que utiliza de acarreo y desde entonces se ha convertido en la herramienta que ha alimentado a su familia.   
El realizo el crédito para la compra  de una batería para su camión porque la que tenían anteriormente se la robaron. Este es su medio de trabajo el cual necesita que este en bue estado mecánico para poder realizar su trabajo y llevar ingresos a su casa. Entre sus planes esta el comprar un vehículo para utilizarlo para transportar carga pesada  y poder hacer viajes a Costa Rica para obtener mejores ingresos y priorizar el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
52-year old Timoteo is a native of La Isla Ometepe, Granada. He’s been driving freight trucks for 27 years. He’s married and has two children. 

He started this work when he travelled for the first time from his home town to the city of Granada and saw how much commercial traffic there was because Granada is one of the the cities most visited by foreigners. At the time his wife was pregnant with their first child, and he decided to sell his land in La Isla and go to live in Granada where he bought a simple house. Through faith and hope he gradually managed to improve his lot in life. He became a port captain and then started his business when he got his first loan. He bought a truck which he uses for cargo, and which has become the tool with which he feeds his family.

Timoteo needed a loan to buy a battery for his truck because the one he had was stolen. This is the way he earns his living so he needs a truck in a good state of repair. One of his future plans is to buy a vehicle to transport heavy goods so he can make trips to Costa Rica, earn more money, and continue improving the wellbeing of his family.

loans.use: to buy a battery for his truck

loans.name: Jaime De Jesus

texts.es:
Jaime es una persona muy trabajadora y la cual siempre ha querido sacar adelante su esposa y sus 3 hijos.
Jaime desde hace aproximadamente 4 años se dedica a la agricultura, y en su vereda tiene un terreno donde tiene un cultivo de café y de mora.
Gracias a esto, Jaime genera los ingresos necesarios para su hogar, sin embargo, los ingresos no son muy altos, por lo que solo cubre las necesidades básicas de su familia.
Jaime cuenta con un gran cultivo de mora, que es el que mayores ingresos le genera en comparación con su cultivo de café, por esto, este cultivo es el que más trabaja y al que sus clientes más quieren comprar. Jaime vende su cultivo de moras al mismo cliente cada 8 días, quien desde que montó su cultivo le ha comprado a muy buen precio sus cosechas.
Jaime actualmente esta cosechando su cultivo de moras pero no cuenta con un capital suficiente que le permita comprar el abono necesario para su cultivo. Es por esto que Jaime tiene las aspiración a que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de el abono para este cultivo de mora y lo pueda sacar adelante para recibir un buen precio por el y siga generando los ingresos necesarios para el sustento de su familia.
Jaime tiene el sueño de que sus 3 hijos puedan acceder a una mejor educación, y que en un futuro no tengan que pasar por tantas adversidades en la vida como lo ha hecho el. Es por eso que Jaime siempre ha querido brindarles todas las posibilidades para que salgan adelantes y espera que su cultivo sea la fuente de ingresos para que esto se pueda cumplir.
texts.en:
Jaime is a very hardworking person.  He has always wanted to provide a good life for his wife and three children.  For the past four years, Jaime has worked in agriculture.  Along a footpath, he has some land where he grows coffee and blackberries.  Thanks to this, Jaime generates sufficient income for his home; the income is not much, however, and only covers the basic necessities of his family.  

Jaime depends on a large crop of blackberries, which is what generates the most income, compared with his crop of coffee.  For this reason, his crop of blackberries is what he works hardest for, and what his customers most want to buy.  Jaime sells his blackberry crop to the same person every eight days, who has purchased his harvest for a very good price ever since Jaime started growing them.  

Jaime is currently harvesting his crop of blackberries, but his capital is insufficient to purchase the fertilizer necessary for the crops.  For this reason, Jaime hopes that a loan will allow him to purchase the fertilizer for this crop of blackberries, sell the harvest for a good price, and continue generating the necessary income to support his family.  

Jaime has a dream that his three children can access higher education and that in the future, they do not have as many challenges in life as he has had in his own.  For this reason, Jaime always has wanted to provide them with all opportunities so they might succeed.  He hopes that his crops become a source of income so that his dream can be fulfilled.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his crop of blackberries.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 49 years old.  She has been farming for 10 years and currently employs one farmhand.  Her produce of milk and maize are both sold locally.  She earns additional income from her employment as a teacher.

She has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo in order to venture into poultry by buying poultry birds.  She says that expanding into poultry will help her to increase her income and to educate her children as well as to provide for their basic needs.

She laments the price fluctuation of farm products.

loans.use: to buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es:
Emprendedor es la mejor palabra con la que se puede describir a Felipe, un joven de la ciudad de Medellín que desde hace bastante tiempo viene trabajando con el fin de generar sus propios ingresos y poder mejorarles la calidad de vida a sus padres. 
Felipe tuvo que abandonar su municipio natal debido a problemas económicos, por lo que tuvo que emigrar hacia Medellín y así poder superar esta adversidad.
Desde entonces Felipe se dedica a la venta de alimentos en algunos sectores de la ciudad, y gracias a esto genera los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar. 
Felipe actualmente tiene unas buenas ventas, y sus clientes lo tienen como un referente por el buen sabor de sus productos, por lo que Felipe quiere seguir aumentando sus ventas y poder seguir ayudando a sus padres con los gastos de su hogar. 
Con el ánimo de diversificar sus productos, Felipe quiere incluir a los productos que vende, la venta de arepas de chócolo, pues considera que en las horas de la mañana esto se vendería muy bien, y para esto necesita la compra de una parrilla para poderlas calentar. Sin embargo, Felipe no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para poder comprarla, por lo que aspira a que un crédito le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de una parrilla para calentar las arepas de chócolo y poder seguir aumentando sus ingresos.
Felipe espera que con el aumento de sus ingresos sus padres puedan obtener una mejor calidad de vida, y puedan descansar de lo tanto que han trabajado.
Felipe tiene el gran sueño de poder tener una cadena de comidas rápidas en la ciudad, por esto todos los días trabaja con mas esfuerzo y dedicación por sus sueños.
texts.en:
Entrepreneur is the best word to describe Felipe, a young man from the city of Medellín, who has been working for quite some time now in order to generate his own income and be able to improve his parents’ quality of life.  Felipe had to leave the town of his birth due to economic problems and moved to Medellín to overcome this adversity.  Since then, Felipe has been selling food in some of the city’s sectors and thanks to this generates income necessary to cover household expenses.

Felipe’s sales are currently good and his customers know him because of his tasty food preparation so Felipe wants to continue increasing sales to continue to help his parents with household expenses.  Hoping to diversify his products, Felipe wants to add to the products he sells the sale of “arepas de chócolo” [corn griddle cake stuffed with sweet corn and farmer's white cheese] because he thinks that they would sell very well in the morning.  To do so, he has to buy a grill to warm them up.  However, Felipe does not have enough money to buy it and is hoping for a loan that will make it possible for him to purchase a grill to warm up arepas de chócolo to continue increasing his income.

Felipe hopes that with the increased income his parents will obtain a better quality of life and they will be able to rest from all their hard work.  Felipe has a great dream which is to own a chain of fast food places throughout the city and this is why he works every day with more effort and dedication in order to reach his dreams.

loans.use: to buy a grill.

loans.name: Oscar Dario

texts.es:
Oscar Darío es una persona que se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajador y dedicado a su familia. Es padre de un hijo de 11 años, del que manifiesta es el motor para todos los días salir a trabajar fuertemente. 
Oscar Darío sueña con que su hijo pueda tener acceso a una buena educación y una estabilidad económica en un futuro, para que no tenga que pasar por todas las adversidades que ha tenido que pasar el en su vida.
Oscar Darío desde hace aproximadamente 5 años se encuentra dedicado a su negocio de ferretería, el cual los clientes tienen como referente por su buena atención. 
Oscar Darío quiere poder aumentar sus ingresos para que su esposa y su hijo puedan gozar de una mejor calidad de vida, por lo que quiere aumentar la variedad de productos que vende para hacer más atractivo su negocio para los clientes; sin embargo, actualmente no tiene el dinero suficiente para la compra de todos los productos, por lo que aspira a que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de productos de ferretería con el ánimo de aumentar la variedad que ofrece a sus clientes y poder así tener unos ingresos mayores a los actuales.
Oscar Darío tiene el gran sueño de que su negocio se pueda convertir en un gran almacén y así poder generar ingresos suficientes para poder ofrecerle a su hijo una mejor educación, y en un futuro acceder a una educación universitaria que le permita obtener un empleo bien remunerado.
texts.en:
Oscar Darío is a person who has been characterized as being very hardworking and devoted to his family.   He’s the father of an 11-year-old boy who he states is the motivating force behind his going out every day to work very hard.  Oscar Darío dreams with his son having access to a good education and economic stability in the future so that he won’t have to go through adversities like the ones he’s had to go through in his life.  

Oscar Darío has been selling hardware for about five years; customers are faithful to him because of his good service.  Oscar Darío would like to increase income so that his wife and son can enjoy a better quality of life so he’d like to increase the variety of products he sells so that his store will be more attractive to his customers.  However, he currently lacks sufficient money to buy all the products so he’s hoping for a loan that will make it possible for him to buy the hardware products aiming at increasing variety of stock to offer his customers thus earning higher income than currently.

Oscar Darío’s great dream is that his business will become a great warehouse so that he can generate sufficient income to offer his son a better education so that in future he can access a university education that will lead to a well-paying job.

loans.use: to buy hardware.

loans.name: Mirna Magali

texts.es:
Mirna , 29 años de edad ,casada, madre de 2 hijos , habita en la ciudad de Granada , es comerciante , tiene una pulpería en su casa de habitación , su esposo trabaja como guardia de seguridad mientras ella  atiende su negocio y cuida de sus hijos. Anteriormente ella trabajaba como domestica pero no le ofrecían estabilidad laborar ni lo ingresos fijos para sustentar a su familia, una hermana de ella  le aconsejo que pusiera una pulpería en la casa al principio era muy poco lo que vendía pues no tenia capital suficiente para surtir su venta pero a medida que fue dando a conocer su negocio en el barrio fue introduciendo mas productos y mas clientes han llegado. 
Ella realizo el crédito para compra de granos básicos, azúcar , aceite, avena, jabones, detergentes, cloro, enlatados, fósforos, pan, leche , huevo. Pues estos son parte de los productos que mas buscan sus clientes y de los cuales ella necesita vender para mejorar los ingresos. Ella quiere ir mejorando la mercadería que tiene, comprar mejores estantes para poner en exhibición sus productos.
texts.en:
Mirna is 29 years old, is married, is a mother to two children, and lives in the city of Granada.  She is a merchant who operates a small convenience store in her home.  Her husband works as a security guard while she tends to her business and takes care of their children.  Previously, Mirna used to work as a maid, but the job offered neither stability nor a fixed income to support her family.  One of her sisters advised her to put the convenience store in her house.  

At first, she only sold very little as she did not have enough capital to supply her store.  But she advertised her business in the neighborhood, introduced more products, and more customers have arrived.  

Mirna seeks the loan to buy basic grains, sugar, oil, oats, soap, detergent, bleach, canned goods, matches, bread, milk, and eggs.  These are some of the products most requested by her customers, and they are the ones she must sell to improve her income.  Mirna wants to continue expanding her merchandise and to buy better shelves to display her products.

loans.use: To buy basic grains, sugar, oil, oats, soap, detergent, bleach, canned goods, matches, bread, milk, and eggs.

loans.name: Joaquin Emilio

texts.es:
Joaquín es una persona que ha trabajado toda su vida con el ánimo de sacar su familia adelante, pues siempre le ha gustado poder brindarles el mejor bienestar a sus 5 hijos. Debido a que se separó de la madre de sus hijos, Joaquín actualmente cubre los gastos del hogar donde convive con sus 5 hijos. 
Joaquín quiere que sus hijos puedan tener una buena calidad de vida, y una estabilidad económica para que no tengan que pasar por tantas adversidades como las ha pasado el en la vida.
Joaquín se ha dedicado toda su vida a trabajar en la actividad de la venta de madera, y gracias a esto es que genera los ingresos suficientes para el sustento de su hogar. Joaquín compra lotes de árboles, y luego el los tala obteniendo la madera que posteriormente vende a sus clientes.
Joaquín actualmente tiene grandes pedidos por parte de sus clientes, por lo que debe comprar los lotes de árboles para satisfacer los pedidos que le han hecho, sin embargo, Joaquín actualmente no cuenta con los ingresos suficientes para poder comprar los lotes que requiere, por lo que aspira a que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de los lotes de árboles y poder así cumplir con el pedido de sus clientes y seguir obteniendo los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hogar.
Joaquín tiene el gran sueño de poder obtener grandes ingresos que le permitan cumplirles el anhelo a sus hijos de ingresar a una educación universitaria que los prepare y les permita acceder a un empleo bien remunerado. Además Joaquín quiere que sus hijos puedan progresar económicamente, por lo que quiere que tengan un futuro económico estable, y para ello trabaja muy fuerte todos los días en su empleo.
texts.en:
Joaquín is the type of person who has worked hard his whole life to help his family get ahead. He has always enjoyed doing whatever he could to provide for the wellbeing for his five children.
