Islomjon is a furniture maker and makes couches and armchairs as well as repairs furniture at his shop. He has been making furniture since 1995. At first he was making and repairing furniture in Dushanbe but since then moved to Khujand. During the slow time Islomjon also works as a master construction worker. He need this loan to buy raw materials such as laminate, MDF and wood for making furniture.

loans.use: To buy raw materials

loans.name: Lander Quenis

texts.es:
Lander, un joven de 25 años de edad, quien nació en Yalaguina municipio de Estelí, casado, se dedica a la compra y venta de granos básicos tales como el maíz y frijol . Comenzó sus actividades a la edad de 19 años de edad ahorro un poquito de dinero que el obtuvo cuando trabajaba como carpintero pero después decidió poner su propio negocio. El cual tiene 6 años de estar dedicándose a esto. El vende los granos básicos en el mercado municipal de Somoto y Estelí.
El realizo el crédito para la compra de granos básicos, tales como maíz, arroz y frijol. En sus planes futuros quiere tener diferentes puestos de ventas de granos básicos  para vender al por mayor y tener terreno para construir su casa.
texts.en:
Lander, a 25 year-old young man who was born in Yalaguina in the municipality of Esteli, is married and has a business buying and selling staple grains such as corn and beans.  He started doing this work when he was 19.  He saved a bit of money from working as a carpenter, and later decided to start up his own business.  He has 6 years of experience with this business.  He sells the staple grains in the municipal markets of Somoto and Esteli.  

He is taking a loan to buy staple grains such as corn, rice and beans.  In the future, he plans on having a number of different stalls where he can sell his grains at wholesale, and he also plans to get some land where he can build his own house.

loans.use: to buy staple grains such as corn, rice and beans

loans.name: Hanif

texts.ru: Ханиф женат и имеет троих детей. Он очень трудолюбивый человек и любит работать на земле. Более 20 лет он занимается выращиванием картофеля и гранат, имеет свое дехканское хозяйство «Ш. Каландар» в размере 7 гектаров земли. Ханиф также занимается скотоводством. Ханиф хотел бы получить займ для вспашки земли, покупки минеральных удобрений, семян и крупного рогатого скота. Он надеется на вашу помощь и поддержку.
texts.en: Hanif is married and has three children. He is a very hardworking man and loves to work on the land. He has been cultivating potatoes and pomegranates for more than twenty years and has a farm union called Sh. Kalandar which has seven hectares of land. Hanif also does animal husbandry. He wants to receive a loan to plow the land, buy mineral fertilizer, seeds and large horned cattle. He hopes for your help and support.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds and cattle.

loans.name: José Moises

texts.es:
El señor José tiene 26 años de edad, es soltero y vive con sus padres.

José se ha dedicado a desempeñar las actividades agrícolas, fue su papá quien le enseño y desde hace dos años esta trabajando en el cultivo de hortalizas.

Debido a que José necesita abastecer el mercado, él solicita un préstamo a la Fundación Campo para comprar, semillas de maíz, fríjol, tomate, pepino, 200 yardas de poliducto, insecticidas, fungicidas, fertilizantes y pago de mano de obra. Así él aprovechara la tierra ya que esta ubicada en una buena zona topográfica y vive a 600 metros de la ciudad, por lo que aumentara el número de clientes, obteniendo mayores ingresos lo que le permitirá ahorrar, darle una mejor vida a su familia, realizarle mejoras a su vivienda, comprar ganado bovino y continuar trabajando muy fuerte en las hortalizas para ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Jose is 26 years old, single and lives with his parents.

Jose has been working as a farmer.  His father taught him this trade, and he has been working to cultivate vegetables for 2 years.  

Since Jose needs to supply products to the market, he is requesting a loan from the Fundación Campo so that he can buy seeds to grow corn, beans, tomatoes, and cucumbers.  He will also buy 200 yards of plastic irrigation piping, insecticides, fungicides, and fertilizers, and he will pay for some labor.  In this way, he will be able to take full advantages of his land, which is located in a good topographical zone, 600 meters from the city.  This will allow him to have more customers and obtain better earnings. As a result, he will be able to save and provide a better life for his family, make improvements to his house,  buy cattle, and  continue to work hard on his vegetable cultivations so that he can help his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds to grow corn, beans, tomatoes, and cucumbers, and to pay for 200 yards of plastic irrigation piping, insecticides, fungicides, fertilizers, and labor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soda, bread, and sugar

loans.name: Hilda Yaneth

texts.es: Hilda Yaneth, se siente muy gozosa por haber alcanzado su meta sobre este credito, la cual es cancelarlo antes de tiempo .  Nuevamente hace solicitud de un nuevo credito  para seguir  trabajando ya que el negocio sigue creciendo a travez de los pedidos.  Con el inconfundible apoyo de su esposo tienen grandes sueños, uno de ellos es tener una casa mas grande, ya que aun vive con sus suegros  en su propio terreno pero sueñan con una casa mas grande para la familia y para trabajar mejor con sus empleados.  Ella también se dedica coser en su propio negocio y asi se mantiene el mayor tiempo con sus colaboradores, para que el trabajo sea mas rápido y mejor elaborado. Hay varios pedidos pero aun la tela no le alcanza por ello necesita comprar varios rollos de tela o sea materia prima y asi completar los pedidos de sus clientes, cada rollo le cuesta Q. 1032.00 (quetzales) y necesita muchos colores para hacer mejores prendas.  Les dice muchas gracias por incluirla en su gran listado de personas y el conocerla a travez de una foto y sobre todo el que la ayuden a seguir luchando por la vida y darle lo mejor a su regalo mas hermoso la cual son sus hijos. Gracias.
texts.en:
Hilda Yaneth is very grateful for having reached her goal for her loan which she paid off early. Currently she is asking for a new loan in order to continue working as her business continues growing through her orders.

With the unequivocal support of her husband they have big dreams. One of them is to have a larger home on their own land, as they are living with their in-laws, but they dream of a bigger house for the family and to work better with their employees.

She also works sewing, in her own business, and this is how she spends most of her time, with her assistants, because the work must be very fast and well made. There are several orders but not enough fabric so she needs to buy several rolls of fabric or prime material in order to fulfill the requests of her clients. Each roll costs Q1032.00 quetzales and she needs several colors in order to make better garments.

She says thank you very much for including her on the long list of people and meeting her through her photo and above all for helping her to continue fighting for life so she can give her best to her children who are a beautiful gift. Thank you.

loans.use: to buy rolls of fabric, or raw materials to make clothes

location.town: Aldea Vista Hermosa, San Pedro Sacatepequez

loans.name: Liseth

texts.es:
Liseth, es costurera, tiene un hijo el cual esta estudiando su cuarto año de la secundaria, ella habita en Pueblo Nuevo municipio de Estelí. Inicio su actividad en el sector de corte y confección de ropa a los 29 años de edad, este oficio lo heredo de su madre. Al terminar la secundaria aprendió a especializarse en la costura y estableció su propio taller a medida que pasaba el tiempo fue adquiriendo clientes y comprando maquinas de coser usadas. Ella su sobrina y su hermana trabajan juntas en este taller por el cual luchan día a día para salir adelante. 
Ella realizo el crédito para compra de tela para hacer uniformes escolares, trajes para deportes, pantalones, faldas pues la temporada escolar esta muy cerca y quiere aprovechar esta oportunidad. Uno de sus sueños es dar empleos a mas personas en su taller ya que lo desea ampliar y construir una vivienda digna para su familia.
texts.en: Liseth is a seamstress, she has a son who is in high school and she lives in the municipality of Pueblo Nuevo of Estelí. She started working in the cutting and tailoring sector at 29 years of age, a trade she learned from her mother. When she finished high school, she learned to sew, specializing in dressmaking and established her own studio. As time passed, she acquired a clientele and she bought used sewing machines. Her niece and sister work with her in the studio, and together, they fight one day at a time, to get ahead. She is asking for the loan to buy fabric to make school uniforms, sport uniforms, pants and skirts, as the school year is approaching and she’d like to take advantage of this opportunity. One of her dreams is to hire more employees in her studio so she can expand her business and build a dignified home for her family.

loans.use: buy fabric to make school uniforms, sport uniforms, pants and skirts.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a businesswoman who runs a pharmacy. She has been in the business for the past seven years, and has employed one person. Gladys says she has a good business environment because she has regular customers. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save her income.

Gladys is requesting a 50,000 KES loan to buy medicine to sell. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicine to sell

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina is a 50-year-old married woman. She has 5 children with ages ranging from 6 years to 21 years. She describes herself to be aggressive and confident. She operates a rental service business where she provides rental house services. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located at a strategic area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for renovating the houses. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to pay for the renovation of the rental houses. Amina's business goal is to be a real estate manager of her own houses within 5 years.

loans.use: to pay for the renovation of the rental houses

loans.name: Fuadi

texts.en: Fuadi is a 37-year-old married man. He has 3 children with ages ranging from 2 years to 10 years. He describes himself to be honest and intelligent. He operates a retail business where he sells chickens. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a fast-growing area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for buying more chickens. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more chicken feed and chickens for selling. Fuadi's business goal is to be a supplier of chicken in major towns within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more chicken feed and chickens for selling

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is a 30-year-old married woman. She has 4 children with ages ranging from 4 years to 10 years. She describes herself to be decisive woman. She operates a restaurant where she sells tea, snacks, food, etc. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a viable area. In addition, Joyce provides rental house services to increase her income. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the restaurant. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more ingredients such as flour, cooking fat, and sugar for preparing food. Her business goal is to run a bigger restaurant within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients such as flour, cooking fat, and sugar for preparing food

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizer and maize seeds

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a 33-year-old single young woman. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a grocery store where she sells tomatoes. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a viable area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the perishability of tomatoes. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more tomatoes for selling. In the next 5 years, Jane's business goal is to run a similar grocery store.

loans.use: to purchase more tomatoes for selling

loans.name: Elvis

texts.en: Elvis is a 43-year-old married man. He has 4 children with ages ranging from 5 years to 20 years. He describes himself to be honest and caring. He operates a retail store where he sells home products such as blue band, sugar, salt, wheat flour, maize flour, and tea leaves. He has been involved in this business for 7 years. His business is located in a viable area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high price of home products. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase more home products. Elvis's business goal is to be a wholesaler within 5 years.

loans.use: to purchase more home products for selling

loans.name: Shameem's Group

texts.en:
Shameem is 41 years old and is married with three sons. Her eldest son is studying in third grade and the others are still too young to attend school. Shameem runs a business selling used clothes in her community. She also knows the art of sewing and works as a tailor if she gets an order. In this photo, Shameem is holding a book called the Asasah passbook. 

Shameem is requesting a loan from the Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s ready-made garment business. Her husband will buy a large amount and variety of garments to increase his sales and profits. Shameem is confident that her husband will be able to improve his business with her loan which will help her family attain a better financial life.

loans.use: to buy garments to sell

loans.name: Salimata

texts.fr:
SALIMATA est née vers 1978 à NIENA, est mère de 6 enfants et vit chez son époux à Niena (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elle mène cette activité de commerciale de poissons depuis plus de 7 ans. Son expérience dans ce domaine, lui a valu une bonne réputation et reçoit des commandes de poissons. Ainsi pour avoir les ressources nécessaires afin de satisfaire ces clients, elle  décida de collaborer avec l’Institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso, il ya 5 ans maintenant, tous les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés.  
Ce nouveau prêt lui permettra d’acheter, 10 paniers de poissons fumé par mois.
Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés de Mopti, Sevaré ainsi qu’à Sikasso. Les ventes sont généralement sur commande, à une clientèle composée de femmes, à crédit et au comptant. 
Avec ce prêt, elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35 000 FCFA par mois. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
Elle compte devenir un grossiste de bonne renommée à fin de satisfaire ses nombreux clients qui ne cessent de croître
texts.en:
Salimata was born around 1978 in Niena. She is the mother of six children and lives with her husband in Niena (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). She has been practicing her commercial fish trade for over seven years. Her experience in this field has earned her a good reputation and she receives fish orders.

Five years ago she decided to work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to have the necessary resources to meet her customers’ demand. All her previous loans have been fully reimbursed.

This new loan will allow her to buy 10 baskets of smoked fish each month. She gets her supplies at the Mopti and Sevare markets, as well as in Sikasso. The sales are usually made with an advanced order to customers who are women and pay cash or on credit.

With this loan, she is planning to make a monthly profit of 35, 000 Francs CFA. This profit will enable her to pay her loan and to invest the rest in her activity. She plans on becoming a wholesaler with a good reputation to meet the demand of her ever increasing customers.

loans.use: to purchase fish

loans.name: Safia's Group

texts.en:
Safia has three children, two of whom are studying and one who is too young to attend school. She is a seamstress who sews clothes for clients to financially support her husband. In this photo, Safia is holding a book called the Asasah passbook. 

Safia is requesting a loan from the Kiva partner Asasah to use for her husband’s bed sheet business. Her husband will buy cloth, thread, and other raw materials to make a greater quantity of higher quality bed sheets to increase his sales and profits. Safia's husband has been operating his business for many years, and she has full confidence that his business will grow as a result of loan. She is hopeful that her husband's increased profit will allow her to send her youngest son to school next year.

loans.use: to buy cloth, thread, and materials to make bed sheets

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is a 42-year-old married woman who has three children between the ages of three and 15. For the past three years, she has operated a retail store where she sells products such as sugar, salt, maize flour, snacks, soda, tea leaves, and other items. Martha describes herself as social and someone who likes sharing ideas. Her business is located in an urban area and her biggest business challenge is insufficient funds to improve her shop. 

Martha is requesting a 15,00 KES loan to purchase cooking fat and maize flour to sell. Her business goal is to become a wholesaler in a nearby town within five years.

loans.use: to purchase cooking fat and maize flour to sell

loans.name: Jose Octavio

texts.es:
José Octavio es una persona que ha sufrido toda clase de adversidades en su vida. Hace un tiempo la madre de sus hijos lo abandonó y el quedó a cargo de sus 2 hijos de 3 y 10 años.
José Octavio siempre ha querido que sus hijos crezcan en un buen hogar y nunca tenga que verse en situaciones adversas como le ha tocado a el.
José Octavio desde hace 15 años se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo como son snacks, frutas, gaseosas, entre otros en una carretera a las afueras de su municipio, donde sus ventas siempre han sido buenas pero ha tenido que padecer los problemas de la inseguridad, pues hace poco le hicieron un robo de mercancía y dinero que lo dejó al borde de la quiebra y sus hijos tuvieron que ver como hasta sus necesidades básicas se vieron en problemas para suplirse.
José Octavio con el ánimo de recuperar gran parte de su mercancía, requiere comprar productos de consumo, sin embargo, actualmente no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar estas compras, por lo que tiene la esperanza en que un préstamo le permitirá acceder a la compra de productos de consumo como snacks, frutas, gaseosas, entre otros y volver así a recuperar su surtido y tener productos que ofrecer a sus clientes para la venta.
José Octavio aspira a que su negocio se recupere y le vuelva a generar ingresos suficientes como para atender las necesidades básicas en su familia, y de este modo sus hijos podrán gozar de una mejor calidad de vida.
José Octavio tiene el gran sueño de que sus hijos tengan la posibilidad de acceder a una educación de calidad, y en un futuro ingresar a un estudio universitario que les permita prepararse para encontrar un buen empleo y bien remunerado.
texts.en:
José Octavio is someone who has suffered all kinds of adversity in his life. Some time ago, the mother of his children abandoned him and left him in charge of 2 children, 3 and 10 years old.
José Octavio has wanted his children to grow up in a good home and not have to find themselves in the adverse situations that he has. For 15 years, José Octavio has sold consumer goods like snacks, fruit and pop, among other things, from a cart outside his municipality. His sales have always been good, but he’s had to endure some insecure times. A short while ago, his merchandise and money were stolen, leaving him on the edge of bankruptcy and his sons had to endure being in a situation where even their basic needs couldn’t be met. With the intention of recuperating a large part of his merchandise, José Octavio needs to purchase consumer goods. Unfortunately, he doesn’t have enough money to do so, that’s why he’s hoping for a loan that can permit him to purchase consumer goods, such as snacks, fruit and pop, among other things, and that way recuperate his inventory to be able to offer products to his clients. José Octavio 
Wants his business to recover and to generate sufficient income to attend to the basic needs of his family, so his children can enjoy a better quality of life. José Octavio’s dream is that his children have access to quality education and in the future are able to get a university education that will prepare them to find a good job that pays well.

loans.use: buy consumer goods like snacks, fruit and pop, so he can recuperate his business after being robbed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of clothing and lotions.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a 34-year-old married woman who has four children with ages ranging from three to 15 years. For the past five years, she has operated a restaurant where she sells snacks, tea, and food. Ruth describes herself as responsible, faithful, and innovative. Her business is located in an urban area and Ruth also runs a grocery store to increase her income. Her biggest business challenge is insufficient funds to improve the restaurant. 

Ruth is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to buy more ingredients for preparing food. Her business goal is to run a hotel within five years.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare food

loans.name: Slavik

texts.en:
Slavik is involved in agriculture and keeps cattle and has an orchard. He also works at a local restaurant as a cook. Slavik lives with his wife and two sons, who help him with his farm. 

Slavik is requesting a loan to buy three cows for breeding. Increasing his herd will improve his income and he will invest his profit in his farm's further development.

loans.use: to purchase cows

loans.name: Ana Carolina

texts.es:
Emprendedora es la mejor palabra con la que se puede caracterizar a Ana Carolina, una joven de de 19 años de edad que busca generar sus propios ingresos trabajando fuertemente con el ánimo de sacar sus estudios adelante y mejorarles la calidad de vida a sus padres.
Ana Carolina se ha encontrado con la gran dificultad de las pocas oportunidades laborales, por lo que no cuenta con unos ingresos que le permitan pagarse sus estudios, además, sus padres no tienen una buena estabilidad económica, por lo que quiere aportar al hogar para que sus padres puedan mejorar su situación económica.
Es por esto que Ana Carolina inició su negocio de venta de productos por catálogo, donde vende productos como ropa, cosméticos, entre otros, y gracias a esto ha podido empezar a generar ingresos para su hogar, y poder aspirar a ingresar a un estudio universitario.
Ana Carolina ofrece en sus revistas, productos de muy buena calidad, además de que lo combina con una muy buena atención en su servicio, por lo que sus clientes le han hecho muy buenos pedidos y ella espera que sigan creciendo.
Actualmente Ana Carolina tiene grandes pedidos por parte de sus clientes, por lo que debe comprar la mercancía para poderles entregar estos pedidos, sin embargo, y debido a que apenas esta iniciando su negocio, Ana Carolina no cuenta con el capital suficiente para comprar esta mercancía, por lo que tiene la esperanza de que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de mercancía como lociones, cosméticos, ropa entre otros y poder cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes.
Ana Carolina tiene un gran sueño y es el de poder ingresar a una carrera universitaria, por esto siempre quiere aumentar sus ingresos para poder ahorrar y matricularse en una carrera. Además, sueña con que sus padres puedan mejorar su calidad de vida, y puedan obtener una mejor estabilidad económica en sus vidas.
Ana Carolina aspira a que su negocio, le va a poder brindar el cumplimiento de estos sueños.
texts.en:
Enterprising is the word that would best describe Ana Carolina, a 19-year-old young woman who is trying to generate her own income by working very hard in order to study and to improve her parents’ quality of life.
Ana Carolina has come face to face with a great difficulty: the lack of job opportunities. This means she does not have the necessary income to pay for university studies. Moreover, her parents’ economic situation is not stable, so she wants to contribute to the family income so they can improve this.
It is for these reasons that Ana Carolina started her own catalogue sales business. She sells clothes and cosmetics, among other products, and thanks to this, she has been able to generate income for her family and she can now aspire to get into university. 
Ana Carolina offers very good quality products in her catalogues, which she combines with excellent customer service. Her customers have placed a good amount of orders and she hopes they will continue to increase.
Currently Ana Carolina has many orders and she needs to buy the merchandise so that she can deliver them. However, because she is only getting started, she does not have the necessary capital to buy what she needs. She hopes a loan will give her the opportunity to buy merchandise such as lotions, cosmetics and clothes, among others, and be able to fulfill her customers’ orders.
Ana Carolina’s great dream is to be able to study a university career. It is for this reason that she wants to increase her income, so that she can save and enroll in college. She also dreams that her parents’ quality of life can improve and that they can achieve more economic stability.
Ana Carolina aspires to see her dreams come true thanks to her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as lotions, cosmetics and clothes, among others, to fulfill her customers' orders.

loans.name: Villa Hermosa Uno Group

texts.es:
La señora Ricarda Petronila es casada tienen 54 años de edad, cursó el tercer grado educacion primaria,  tiene 2 hijos  de los cuales ninguno esta estudiando, se dedica al comercio a la venta de productos para consumo diario en una tienda, inicio este negocio con un capital pequeño y prestado y hasta el momento lleva 12 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la construcción de vivienda.

Organiza un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de mas productos para su tienda, ya que espera que su negocio sea grande  y con mejores ganancias. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedica a la atención de tienda en general, venta de refacciones, siembra de verduras y crianza de4 animales.
texts.en:
Ricarda Petronilla is a 54 year old, married woman. She studied until grade 3, she has 2 children, neither goes to school. She works selling everyday groceries in a store. She started this business with a little bit of capital that she borrowed and now has 12 years of experience. She counts on the help of her husband who is a construction worker.

She organized a group to solicit a loan that she will use to buy more products for her store, as she hopes her business expands and makes more money. The other members of the group work as salesclerks in general, in spare parts, growing vegetables and animal husbandry.

loans.use: buy groceries for her store.

loans.name: José Transito

texts.es:
El señor José tiene 37 años de edad, es padre soltero, vive con su mamá, hermanos y con su hija.

Él tiene 22 años de trabajar en las actividades agrícolas. Además de este trabajo, José presta sus servicios como vigilante en un museo. Fue su papá quien le enseño y lo incentivo a desempeñar estas actividades.

José compra los insumos agrícolas en una ciudad que esta a 39 kilómetros del municipio de donde vive y la distancia de su casa hasta donde aborda el autobús es de 8 kilómetros, por lo que camina una hora y media.

Él solicita un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar una refrigeradora, debido a que hace unos días instalaron la energía eléctrica en su casa y su objetivo es vender productos helados, ya que en ese lugar no hay quien venda y eso representaría una buena fuente de ingresos, para que él pueda mejorar su situación económica. José desea instalar su propia tienda en su casa y abastecer a la comunidad de lo necesario y mejorar su condición de vida.
texts.en:
Jose is 37 years old. He is a single father and lives with his mom, brothers and his daughter. 

He has 22 years of experience working in agriculture. Aside from agricultural work he also serves as a museum guard. It was his father who taught him how and encouraged him to perform these activities. 

Jose buys agricultural supplies in a city that is 39 kilometers from the municipality where he lives. The distance from his house to where he catches the bus is 8 kilometers, which takes him an hour and a half to walk. 

He has requested a loan from 'Fundación Campo' to buy a refrigerator. A few days ago he had electricity installed in his home and now his goal is to sell ice cream. Currently there is no one in his area that sells ice cream, so this could be a good source of income that will allow him to improve his economic situation. Jose wants to open a small store out of his home and supply the community with necessities and by doing so improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and sell ice cream products.

loans.name: Suren

texts.en:
Suren lives in Bagravan village. He is a teacher at the local school.   In addition, he is also involved in agriculture. He keeps cattle and cultivates land.  He also runs a mill.  

Suren has applied for a loan to modernize his mill.  He would like to purchase some new equipment for the mill. This will allow him to organize the work of the mill more effectively and make it more profitable.

loans.use: buy mill equipment

loans.name: Saribek

texts.en: Saribek keeps cattle. He has been involved  in cattle breeding for many years and through this business has sustained his family of six.  Saribek lives with his wife, sister and his three children. Now Saribek would like to expand his farm. With an increased number of cattle, Saribek will get more profit. The growing business will insure his family’s sustainability, and the children’s nutrition and education needs.

loans.use: buy more cattle

loans.name: Suren

texts.en: Suren is a 42-year-old farmer from Arteni village. He lives with his wife and children. Suren has applied for this loan to increase his number of cattle.  With the requested amount, he plans to use to purchase cattle.  Suren and his family will greatly benefit from a business expansion. He intends to use the profits to provide for the needs of his wife and children.

loans.use: buy cattle

loans.name: Onduso

texts.en: Onduso is 24 years old.  He is married and has one child, aged two years. He  does photography to earn a living.  He has been in this business for 5 years and has employed one person. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Onduso has been able to save his income and hopes to expand his business in the future.  Onduso has applied for 20,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy a photo printer.

loans.use: buy a photo printer

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is 34 years old.  He is married and has three children.  He does carpentry to earn a living.  He has been in this business for 14 years and has employed one person. He describes his business environment as good because there is limited competition. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Paul has been able to save his income and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 20,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy timber and nails.

loans.use: buy timber and nails

loans.name: Artur

texts.en: Artur is a young entrepreneur from Yerevan. He trades coffee and tea from a rented booth in the city market. Artur has applied for this loan to develop his business.  He plans to purchase more tea and increase the variety of this products. This will allow him to increase sales and get more income. This is vital for Artur, as he plans to get married soon, and with the additional income he will create more prosperous conditions for his family.

loans.use: buy tea

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en: Francisca is 20 years old.  She runs a grocery store to earn a living. She has been in the business for 2 years and describes her business environment as competitive because many people do the same business.  Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Francisca has been able grow her business.  She hopes to be financially stable in the future.  Francisca has applied for 20,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy tomatoes, potatoes and other vegetables.

loans.use: buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Nlibakari

texts.en:
Nlibakari is applying for another loan to expand her boutique business and start another business of selling lesos (Kanga, women wrapping cloth). She will use this 30,000 Kes loan to purchase 20 pairs of lesos (Kanga) for resale. In the future, Nlibakari aspires to continue improving her businesses. 

Since taking her last Kiva loan, Nlibakari has greatly improved her family’s standard of living. She hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders and thanks for your support!

loans.use: To purchase 20 pairs of lesos for resale.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married woman with five children, four boys and one girl. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past six years, she has operated a food stall business; her potential customers are neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a 57-year-old married woman with seven children who are all grown up. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

Mwanamisi has operated a milk-selling business for the past 10 years. In addition she also practices small-scale farming and livestock (cows and goats) keeping. Her potential clients are the local area villagers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of establishing a dairy farm in the future.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase more dairy cattle for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to uplift her living standards and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more dairy cattle for her business.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 47 years old and has had 25 straight years in farming, which she says has been the source of livelihood for her family of 7 children.  She adds that six of her children, who are still schooling, rely fully on her farming income for their upkeep and education.  She currently produces maize, milk and beans besides running a second-hand clothes retail business in the local market.

Gladys has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help her venture into poultry farming by buying poultry birds.  She had previously acquired a loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi, which she used to buy a dairy cow and appreciates the boost it has given to her farming income.  She says she will continue farming  as it is the lifeline for her family.  She however laments the high costs of production in the form of inputs.

loans.use: buy poultry birds

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a married man. He has 2 children with ages ranging from 6 years to 12 years. He describes himself to be principled and honest. He operates a retail store where he sells spare parts.  

Joseph has been involved in this business for 7 years. His business is located in a strategic area.  He describes his biggest business challenge to be the delay of payments from customers.  He will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase more spare parts to sell.  Joseph's business goal is to be importing spare parts to sell within 5 years.

loans.use: buy spare parts

loans.name: Qalib

texts.en:
Qalib is a 52-year-old married man with two sons.  He sells clothes, home products and perfumes. He has 10 years of experience in this field, which makes him an experienced and skilled person in the business.

Qalib started his business because he was not able to find a job to cover the needs of his family.   The products he sells are very popular among the local people, especially perfumes and children's clothes.  His monthly income is 150 AZN. Qalib is not alone in his business, his wife helps him to choose products for sale because she has good taste.
 
Qalib knows what  his customers need, which products are in demand, and he wishes to expand his business. For this purpose, he has applied for a loan of 1000 AZN. He will use it to purchase more merchandise for his shop.

loans.use: buy home products

loans.name: Mwanahalima

texts.en:
Mwanahalima is a 49-year-old married woman with five children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

Mwanahalima has operated a food stall for the past six years; her potential clients are the local area residents. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of establishing a hotel in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase more stocks of wheat flour, maize flour, rice, beans and cooking oil for her business. She decided to join Yehu because it has favorable terms and conditions.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of wheat flour, maize flour, rice, beans and cooking oil for her business.

loans.name: Martha Reina

texts.es:
Doña Martha, de 50 años de edad, originaria de Granada, nos ario las puertas de su casa para mostrarnos el cambio positivo atravez del primer préstamo Kiva por el cual esta muy agradecida. Ya que lo utilizo para compra de inventario para su pulpería y materia prima para su costura. Ahora tiene más visitas de  clientes ya que ofrece más productos  que ahora tiene mas productos que ofrecer y su negocio va creciendo poco a poco.
Ella solicita este crédito para compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite, productos de limpieza, pan, caramelos, condimentos, medicamentos, jugos, leche, mantequilla. Esta inversión le ayudara a surtir mas su pulpería atraer  más clientes y hacer más estable y con buenos ingresos su negocio. Por el cual lucha día a día por salir adelante y ganarse la vida honradamente.
texts.en:
Doña Martha, age 50, is originally from Granada. She opened the doors of her house to demonstrate the positive change brought about by her first Kiva loan and is very grateful. She already used the money to purchase inventory for her grocery store and materials for sewing. Now her customers visit more often since she has more products to offer. Her business has grown little by little.

Martha is requesting a loan to buy rice, sugar, oil, cleaning products, bread, caramels, condiments, medicines, juices, milk, and butter. This investment will help to restock her store so that she can attract more customers. As a result, her business will be more stable and generate good income. For this reason, she strives to press forward day after day and earn an honest living.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, cleaning products, bread, caramels, condiments, medicines, juices, milk, and butter.

loans.name: Delonice

texts.en:
Delonice is a mother of two aged 6 and one year old and has been in farming for five years. She is aged 24 and a teacher. Her farm produces tea and eggs for the local market. She lives with her family in her rural home in Litein, South Rift, Kenya.

Delonice has requested a loan of  20,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry birds. She says her experience in poultry farming has endowed her with the knowledge which will enable her family to get enough income for their daily upkeep.

She is however concerned about the high expenditure incurred in managing poultry diseases. She also appreciates Juhudi  Kilimo for the loan services.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Taleh

texts.en:
Taleh is a 28-year-old young man. He is single and lives with his parents. He breeds cattle and has five years of experience in this field. 

Cattle breeding requires a lot of physical activity and spending most of the time in the open air. Pasturing takes 80% of Taleh's time. He usually buys small calves, raises and fattens them for 5-6 months and then resells them for more a profitable price in the livestock bazaar.  Meat is in very high demand in Azerbaijan and people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma.   Taleh's monthly income is 230 AZN and this business is only one source of financial income for his family.  

Taleh would like to purchase more cattle and for this purpose he has applied for 1000 AZN. He needs this loan to increase his monthly turnover and cover the needs of his customers.

loans.use: purchase two calves and fodder

loans.name: Vardan

texts.en: Vardan is an entrepreneur from Yerevan. He breeds and sells rabbits. Vardan needs some financial means to invest in his business. He has applied for this loan to purchase materials to build hutches for the rabbits and to buy forage for them.  This loan will help Vardan to keep his business stable and make savings to invest in its further expansion.

loans.use: pay for forage and materials to build rabbit hutches

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en: Svetlana lives in Dalarik village with her husband and children.  She has been engaged in cattle breeding for ten years. Now Svetlana would like to develop sheep breeding. With this requested loan, she plans to purchase sheep and forage.  The expansion of the farm will allow Svetlana to increase her income and insure better living standards for her children.

loans.use: to pay for sheep and forage

loans.name: Ricardo Domingo

texts.es:
Ricardo, habita en la ciudad de Granada se dedica a la venta de productos variados tales como medicamentos y cosméticos, es casado, tiene dos hijos que están estudiando la primaria. El comenzó su negocio con su mama pero ella enfermo y el se tuvo que hacer cargo además desde niño acompañaba a vender a su madre así que su experiencia es larga. El actualmente vende en el mercado municipal  donde a afluencia de compradores es muy constante. El solicita el crédito para compra de medicamentos, cosméticos, calcetines, camisolas, camisetas. Pues son parte de los productos que ofrece y que más le demandan sus clientes. 
El quiere ir introduciendo nuevos productos para  vender tales como artículos escolares pues la temporada de la escuela esta cerca y quiere aprovechar para vender y hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Ricardo lives in the city of Granada. He sells a variety of products such as medicines and cosmetics. He is married and has two children, who are in primary school. He began his business with his mother, but she became ill and he had to take charge. Furthermore, ever since he was a boy, he accompanied his mother to sell, thus his experience is long. He now sells in the municipal market, where there is a very constant abundance of buyers. He is applying for the loan to buy medicines, cosmetics, socks, blouses, and t-shirts, since they are among the products that he offers and that his customers ask for most.

He wants to continue introducing new products to sell, such as school supplies, since the school season is coming soon and he wants to take advantage of it to sell and to increase his business.

loans.use: to buy medicines, cosmetics, socks, blouses, and t-shirts.

loans.name: Farayil

texts.en:
Farayil  is a 51-year-old man.  He is married and has three children. He breeds sheep and cattle and has 10 years of experience in this field. During these years, Farail has acquired the knowledge and skills required for the business.

Farayil purchases lambs and calves in the central livestock market and raises them. Sheep raising takes about 3-4 months and cattle breeding takes 5-6 months. After fattening the animals, he resells them for a profitable price in the Imishli livestock bazaar.  Meat is in very high demand in Azerbaijan and people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma.  

This business require a lot of physical strength and Farail spends most of his time in the open air. His wife helps him to feed the animals.  His monthly income is 200 AZN and Farail wishes to increase it. As meat is in high demand, he needs more capital to put into his business and cover the market.  For this purpose, he has applied for 1500 AZN. He will use the loan to buy 6 sheep, 2 calves and 1 cow.

loans.use: buy sheep and cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase cattle and fodder

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en: Alfred is a 36-year-old married man. He has four children with ages ranging from 3 years to 10 years. He describes himself as an honest and trustworthy man. He operates a restaurant where he sells food, snacks and tea. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located at a very busy place. He describes his biggest business challenge as insufficient funds for improving the restaurant. He will use this 20,000 Kenyan shilling loan to purchase more ingredients for preparing food. Alfred's  business goal is to run a hotel within five years.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for preparing food.

loans.name: Alma Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Alma  es una señora creativa y amable se dedica a la venta de libros como son encclopedias ,libros de cocina y libros naturistas.
Tiene la cantidad de dos hijos  a quien quiere mucho y por quien trabaja ya que desea darles una mejor vida .
Esta felizmente casada con la señor Netali un señor trabajador a quien quiere por ser una persona compresiva que la poya y le ayuda en lo que pueda.
Ella pidió el préstamo para la compra de mas libros para la venta ya que el contenido de esos libros ayuda mucho y sus clientas aprenden cosas nuevas.
Le da las gracias a fundación por ayudar a las mujeres trabajadoras.
texts.en:
Sra. Alma is a creative and friendly woman who sells books such as encyclopedias, cookbooks, and nature books. She has two children who she loves dearly. For this reason, she works in order to give them a better life. Alma is happily married to Sr. Netali, a hardworking gentleman who wants to be understanding by supporting her and helping her in any way he can.

Alma is requesting a loan in order to purchase more books to sell since they are a great help to her customers in learning new things. She is grateful to Fundación Realidad for helping working women.

loans.use: to buy books to sell.

loans.name: Francisco Anibal

texts.es:
El señor Francisco de 61 años de edad, casado, es comerciante tiene una pequeña pulpería, tiene 4 hijos . El empezó con este negocio cuando se jubiló ya que antes trabajaba como técnico en mecánica con el dinero que le dieron por su retiro fue que el empezó su pulpería pues necesitaba mantener y pagar los gastos de u hogar. Durante estos años le ha resultado rentable su pulpería a pesar de las constantes subidas de precios en los diferentes productos. Peor aun así ha salido adelante el y su familia. 
El solicita el crédito para compra de jugos, gaseosas, agua embotellada, productos lácteos, dulces, galletas, pan, verduras , frutas , pollo ,carnes, huevo, productos de limpieza. Son productos que necesita tener su pulpería para poder vender y generar ingresos pues su idea es ofrecer variedad a sus clientes abastecer las necesidades y hacer sostenible su negocio.
texts.en:
Sr. Francisco is 61 years old, married, and works as a merchant. He manages a small grocery store. Francisco has four children. He started this business when he retired. Francisco previously worked as a mechanic. With the money he received after he retired, he started his grocery store so that he could support himself and pay for the household expenses. During the past few years, his grocery store has been profitable even though the prices of different products are constantly rising. Despite the worst, he and his family have been able to move forward.

Francisco is requesting a loan to buy juices, sodas, bottle water, dairy products, cookies, bread, vegetables, fruits, chicken, meats, eggs, and cleaning products. These products are needed in his store so that he can sell them and generate income. He came up with the idea of offering a variety of products and stocking his store with necessities so that he can maintain a sustainable business.

loans.use: to buy juices, sodas, bottle water, dairy products, cookies, bread, vegetables, fruits, chicken, meats, eggs, and cleaning products.

loans.name: Jose Guadalupe

texts.es:
El señor Jose de 51 años de edad, es comerciante, dueño de una pulpería , habitante de la ciudad de Granada , padre de gemelos . El puso su negocio con capital propio dinero que obtuvo de su anterior trabajo el empezó vendiendo leña a medida que su negocio fue creciendo fue ingresando mas productos hasta que se dio cuenta que la convirtió en una pulpería. El vende frijoles cosidos, cosméticos y leña ya que es de mucho uso y gran necesidad en su vecindario.
El realizo el crédito para compra de aceite, frijoles, leña, azúcar, pan, café, leche, granos básicos. Su meta es darle un bue futuro a sus hijos y hacer productivo rentable su pulpería.
texts.en:
Señor Jose is 51 years old. He is a businessman, owner of a grocery story. He lives in the city of Granada and is the father of twins. He set up his business using his own capital, money that he had earning from his previous job. He began selling firewood, through which his business grew. He continued bringing in more products until he noticed he had converted his business to a grocery store. He sells cooked beans, cosmetics, and firewood, since it is much used and is a great necessity in his neighborhood.

He is taking out the loan to buy oil, beans, firewood, sugar, bread, coffee, milk, and basic grains. His goal is to give a good future to his children and make his grocery store productive and profitable.

loans.use: to buy oil, beans, firewood, sugar, bread, coffee, milk, and basic grains

loans.name: Sirzad

texts.en:
Sirzad is a 47-year-old market vendor.  He is married and has two children. Sirzad has been selling food items, beverages, toiletries, detergents and clothes for the last 10 years. During these years, he has acquired the knowledge and skills required for the business. 

Sirzad is a very friendly and polite person and has permanent clients who always come to his shop to buy something. His wife helps him to sell his products. The food product he sells is very popular among local people and are in high demand. His monthly profit from selling food is 250 AZN. His brother also helps him to sell products in the shop.  

Sirzad is a very successful entrepreneur because of the good location of his shop, in the central bazaar of his home city.  But the profit he gains is not enough to reinvest into the business and covering customers' demand is suffering for this reason. Being the only source of income, his profit is used for family needs. 

Sirzad would like to increase his sales and invest additional capital in his business. For this purpose, he has applied for 1200 AZN. With this loan, he will purchase and diversify additional foodstuff for his store.

loans.use: buy food products

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is involved in cattle breeding. Her farm consists of thirteen cows. Anna uses the milk to make fermented milk and sells it in the city. 

Anna would like to expand her farm and get more milk. Thus she has applied for this loan to purchase three more cows. This will allow her to make more fermented milk and get more income from its sales. With the additional income, she will ensure a better future for her family. 

Anna lives with her husband, daughter, parents-in-law and her husband's sister.

loans.use: buy three daily cows

loans.name: Gatherine

texts.en: Gatherine is 37 years old.  She is a mother of one child.  She sells trousers and skirts to earn a living.  She has been in this business for 11 years and describes her business environment as competitive because many people do the same business.  Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Gatherine has been able to save her income and hopes to expand her business in the future.  She has applied for 50,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy trousers and skirts to sell.

loans.use: buy trousers and skirts

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a  40 year old married woman. She has 4 children with ages ranging from 5 years to 15 years. She describes herself to be honest, trustworthy and faithful. 

Mercy operates a retail stall where she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for 1 year. Her business is located at a strategic and convenient place. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the delay of payments from customers. 

Mercy will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase more charcoal to sell.  Her business goal is to run three similar retail stores within 5 years.

loans.use: buy charcoal

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is 35 years old.  She sells fertilizer and pesticides to earn a living. She has been in the business for 5 years and has employed two people. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Agnes has been able to save her income and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 50,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy fertilizer and pesticides to sell.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en: Raphael is a 25-year-old married man. He describes himself as sociable. He operates a retail store where he sells charcoal. He has been involved in this charcoal business for one year. Previously, he was employed as a security guard. His business is located near a busy area. He describes his biggest business challenge as the high cost of transportation when buying and delivering to customers. He will use this 20,000 Kenyan shilling loan to purchase more charcoal for selling. Raphael's business goal is to be selling charcoal wholesale within the next five years.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for selling.

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en: Priscilla is 39 years old; she is a mother of two children. She sells shoes to earn a living. She has been in the business for five years and describes her business environment as good because there is limited competition. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to educate her children and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 60,000 Kenya Shillings to buy more shoes for resale.

loans.use: To buy more shoes for resale

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en:
Kadzo is a married woman. She has a son who is 10 years old. She describes herself to be an honest woman. She operates a restaurant where she sells tea, food, and snacks. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located at a viable and strategic area. 

Apart from this business, she does farming to increase her income. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the 20,000 Kenyan Shilling (KES) loan to buy wheat flour and rice. Kadzo's business goal is to run a bigger restaurant within five years.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour and rice for preparing food.

loans.name: María Luisa

texts.es:
La señora María tiene 47 años de edad, es madre soltera de un hijo de 20 años de edad.

Ella se dedica al comercio de diferentes artículos para el hogar, desde electrodomésticos hasta la venta de ropa. Es una mujer que enfrenta el día a día con coraje, pues comenta que desde que nació su hijo jamás dio un paso hacia atrás y ha tomado el comercio tan en serio, ya que es su única fuente de ingresos  para ella y su hijo.

María tiene aproximadamente 25 años como comerciante, manifiesta que se intereso por la venta por que su mamá se dedicaba a lo mismo. Maria inicio con una pequeña tienda de productos de primera necesidad, vendía carne que compraba en pequeñas ganaderías de la localidad, hasta que descubrió su trabajo actual que es el comercio de ropa y electrodomésticos, los cuales le generan mejores ganancias que antes.

Algunos de los productos que vende los consigue en los mercados locales, pero la mayoría los compra en otras ciudades a precios más cómodos. Ella se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. el día que realiza las compras y se lleva todo un día, luego las sale a vender en otros lugares y también en su propia comunidad.

La señora Maria solicita el préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar más mercadería, comenta que en estos momentos es cuando aumenta las compras de camisas para los uniformes escolares, entonces aprovechara la ocasión para no solo comprar ropa común, sino también comprara ropa para uniformes escolares, entre otros artículos. 

Para ella es una buena oportunidad que se le presenta, ya que la época le favorece para mejorar sus ingresos. En un futuro María desea continuar con su proyecto de una pequeña tienda de ropa, ya tiene un mostrador en su casa, que es el primer paso para un largo recorrido comentó.
texts.en:
Maria, 47, is the single mother of a 20-year old son.  She sells different household articles, from electrical items to clothing.  She is a woman who confronts every day with courage.  She tells us that since her son was born, she has never gone backwards and has taken her business seriously since it is their only source of income.
Maria has been in sales for about 25 years and she learned from her mother who was also in sales.  Maria opened a small store selling basic goods.  She sold meat that she bought from small local cattle ranches until she found that her current business of selling clothing and electrical items generated more income than the previous work.
She buys some of the products that she sells in local markets but she purchases most of them in other cities at better prices.  The day that she purchases the merchandise she rises at 5 am and it takes her the whole day.  Then she goes to sell in other areas as well as her own community.
Maria is requesting a loan from the Campo Foundation to buy more merchandise.  She tells us that now is when her sales of shirts for school uniforms go up and she takes advantage of this period to not only buy regular clothing, but also to buy the school uniforms, etc.
This is a good opportunity for her since this season is when she can increase her income.  In the future Maria wants to continue with her project of having a small clothing store.  She says that she  has a counter in her house and that is the first step on the long road.

.

loans.use: to buy regular clothing and shirts for school uniforms, etc

loans.name: Ashot

texts.en: Ashot is involved in the agricultural business. He keeps cattle, beehives, and cultivates land. Ashot would like to develop cattle breeding. To implement this goal he has applied for a loan. Ashot plans to purchase three more cows. This will allow him to receive and sell more meat and milk and get additional income. Ashot will save up and invest in the development of other agricultural fields.

loans.use: to pay for cows and forage

loans.name: Vladik

texts.en: Vladik is involved in agriculture. He keeps a greenhouse and beehives. Vladik has applied for this loan to expand his farm and cultivate the land in the greenhouse. With the requested loan Vladik plans to purchase beehives, seeds and fuel. This loan will help Vladik to develop his farm and greenhouse and increase the income, which will help him to insure better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to pay for beehives, seeds and fuel

loans.name: Rima

texts.en: Rima lives in Aygestan village with her husband, son and daughter. The family gets its main income from agriculture: land cultivating and beekeeping. Rima wants to develop her farm and construct a greenhouse, where she will be able to cultivate and make sales during the winter season. This will allow Rima to get a stable income during the whole year and sustain her family.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and greenhouse construction

loans.name: Jonathan Isaac

texts.es:
Jonathan tiene 20 años de edad, es soltero.

Desde hace 10 años él se dedica a realizar actividades agrícolas, fue su papá quien le enseño. Jonathan siembra maíz, se levanta a las 4:00 a.m. a alimentar a sus animales, luego se va donde tiene sembrada su milpa, para llegar ahí debe caminar a pie cinco kilómetros y trabaja toda la mañana. En la tarde trabaja prestando sus servicios, con una yunta de bueyes y cobra por este servicio.

Para adquirir los insumos necesarios para sus cultivos, Jonathan se desplaza a una ciudad del oriente del país, para eso él camina a pie tres kilómetros, luego aborda un autobús hacia la ciudad, compra los insumos y se regresa a su vivienda.

Jonathan solicita un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar fertilizantes y para rastrear la tierra donde sembrara y para pagar el alquiler de la tierra. Así él estará preparado para sembrar y obtendrá una buena cosecha que le permita aumentar sus ingresos, ya que Jonathan desea comprar una vaca para que le produzca leche y tener otro ingreso.
texts.en:
Jonathan is 20 years old and is single.

For ten years he has done agricultural work. It was his father who taught him. Jonathan plants corn. He gets up a 4 a.m. to feed his animals, then he leaves for the place where he plants his corn field. To get there, he has to walk on foot for five kilometers. He works all morning. In the afternoon he hires out his services with a pair of oxen, and he is paid for this work.

To acquire the necessary items for his fields, Jonathan travels to a city in the eastern part of the country; to do this, he walks by foot three kilometers, then he boards a bus to the city, buys his items, and returns to his house.

Jonathan is applying to Fundación Campo for a loan to buy fertilizers, to harrow the land where he will plant, and to pay for the rental of the land. Thus he will be ready to plant and he will obtain a good harvest, which will allow him to increase his income, since he wants to buy a cow, so that it will product milk for him and he will have another income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, to harrow the land where he will plant, and to pay to rent the land

loans.name: Hishigdalai

texts.en:
Hishigdalai is 26 years old and lives in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. He started his bsusiness trading animal hides in 2010 by renting a counter in the market. Now, he's planning to sell meat. His initial business was trading wool, cashmere, leather etc which he got from herders. His suppliers are also able to provide him with meat and he has already rented a counter in the meat market. However he lacks cash to buy supplies. 

He is a sharp and hardworking man who says "my current income is not enough to support a family. I want to be ready when I settle down". He is requesting is 1,000,000 MNT to buy a new stall for the sell meat and to purchase meat to sell.

loans.use: To buy a new stall and to buy meat to sell.

loans.name: Suvdmaa

texts.en:
Suvdmaa is forty-two years old and lives with her husband and three children in Govisumber province. Her husband is a wireman and two of her children study at high-school. 

She has ben running food cart business for four years. During the four years she has extended the business and now delivers food to local offices. Her further plan is to extend the business by having small building and serving customers with tasty good food. She already has regular customers. She is a hardworking lady who says that "I would like to extend my business so that I can save for my children's college fees". 

The total amount she is requesting is 600,000 MNT to buy meat for her meat trading business and a sofa for her house.

loans.use: To buy meat for her business and a sofa for her house.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a 36-year-old married man. He has 4 children with ages ranging from 4 years to 12 years. He describes himself as an honest and intelligent man. He operates a vehicle from which he provides motor vehicle repairs. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a very competitive area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase more spare parts. Peter's business goal is to own his van within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for motor vehicle repair.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en: Anahit runs a bakery in Yerevan. She has been managing the business successfully during the past few years and now has a stable number of clients. In order to organize the bread making process more effectively and increase the quality of bread, Anahit wants to purchase new equipment. This will allow Anahit to make and sell more bread and get more business income. Development of the business will help Anahit to create better living conditions for her family. Anahit lives with her husband, son, daughter-in-law and little grandchild.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment for her bakery

loans.name: Alphonce

texts.en: Alphonce is a 25-year-old married man. He has a daughter who is 2 months old. He describes himself as a diligent and visionary man. He operates a retail store where he sells charcoal. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in a viable area. He is also employed as a private security guard to increase his income. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the stiff competition. He will use this 20,000 Kenyan shilling loan to buy 18 bags of charcoal. Alphonce's business goal is to be selling charcoal wholesale within five years.

loans.use: to buy 18 bags of charcoal for selling.

loans.name: Aramayis

texts.en: Aramayis is engaged in cattle breeding. Aramayis lives with his wife, who helps him with the agricultural business. Their son has left to work abroad and support the family. Aramayis would like to purchase more cattle and expand the farm. He also plans to purchase forage for the cattle. This will allow him to make the farm more profitable. Aramayis's family will greatly benefit from agricultural development, as this will allow his son to come back and get involved in agriculture too and live together with his family in his motherland.

loans.use: to purchase cattle and forage

loans.name: Grigor

texts.en: Grigor is a young retailer from Yerevan. He sells clothing from a rented booth in the city market. Grigor needs some financial investments to expand his business. With the loan's help, he plans to purchase clothing. This will allow Grigor to increase his sales and bring in more income which will be invested in the further development of the business.

loans.use: to pay for clothing

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a 33-year-old married woman. She has 5 children with ages ranging from 3 years to 15 years. She describes herself as a God-fearing and humble woman. She operates a food stall where she sells food. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a residential area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be travelling long distances to sell food. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy ingredients for food. Elizabeth's business goal is to run a bigger restaurant in 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for food for selling.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is 25 years old. He does maize farming to earn a living. He has been in the business for 3 years and has employed one person. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his income and hopes to be financially stable in the future. He has applied for a 35,000 Kenyan shilling loan to buy maize seeds and fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy maize seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Marine

texts.en: Marine is a young retailer from Yerevan. She sells clothing from a rented booth in the city market. Marine lives with her mother, father (who is a construction worker) and three brothers, who are students. Trading is an important part of the household's income and it helps to pay for Marine's brothers' education. Marine plans to increase her sales and bring in more income. For this reason, she plans to purchase clothing. Development of the business will help Marine to cover the family's costs and insure a more stable future for them.

loans.use: to pay for clothing

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is 27 years old and married with one child, age 2. She runs a retail shop to earn a living and also does some farming to earn extra income. She describes her business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to grow her business and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for a 10,000 Kenyan shilling loan to buy sugar, tomatoes and a bar of soap.

loans.use: to buy sugar, tomatoes and a bar of soap

loans.name: Dickson

texts.en: Dickson is 23 years old and married with one child. He does quarrying to earn a living. He has been in the business for 2 years and has employed three people. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his income and hopes to be financially stable in the future. He has applied for a 30,000 Kenyan shilling loan to rent land for quarrying.

loans.use: to rent land for quarrying

loans.name: Levon

texts.en: Levon lives in Kapan with his wife, son and daughter. He is engaged in beekeeping and pig breeding. Agriculture is the family's main income, and it is barely enough to cover the costs. So Levon wants to expand his farm and bring in more income. With the help of this loan, Levon plans to purchase beehives, pigs and forage. This will allow Levon to develop his agricultural business and get additional income, which will allow him to renovate his house and ensure better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to pay for beehives, pigs and forage

loans.name: Jemma

texts.en: Jemma sells clothing. She has been in this business for already 20 years and has successfully managed and expanded it. Now Jemma would like to sells shoes too, and to purchase some sports clothing. This loan will help Jemma to increase her sales and bring in more income which will allow her to ensure a better future for her family. Jemma lives with her husband, son, daughter-in-law and two grandchildren.

loans.use: to pay for clothing and shoes

loans.name: Sambath

texts.en: Sambath, 42, is married and lives with her husband and four children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been working in a church for over six years. They are pastors. Two of her children are employed: one is a garment worker and another one is a mobile phone repairer. Since the factory is far away from home, Sambath is requesting a loan of $1,000 US to purchase a motorbike for her child to commute to work. In the future, she hopes to build a new house to provide better living conditions for her family and to support her children's studies until they get Bachelor's degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her child to commute to work

loans.name: Run

texts.en:
Run (in the photo), age 45, is a security guard and his wife, Sophat, age 44, stays at home and does the housework. They have been married since 1986 and have five children: four sons and one daughter. One works for a restaurant, two are security guards, one is a garment worker and another one attends school. The family lives in a village about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Run is asking for a loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en: Vanna, 47, is married and lives with her husband and four children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a homemaker. Her husband has been a construction foreman for over ten years, earning approximately $6.50 US per day. In order to improve her family's living conditions, Vanna is requesting a loan of $1,000 US to purchase construction materials for building a bathroom and toilet. By doing so, she will have a hygienic toilet and bathroom to use. In the future, she hopes to rebuild her present house and support her children in  higher education.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for building her bathroom and toilet

loans.name: Soklim

texts.en: Soklim, 27, is married and lives with her husband and one child in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a garment worker, earning approximately $3 US per day. Her husband is a mechanic, earning approximately $4 US per day. Due to the difficulty in traveling to work, Soklim is requesting a loan of $700 US to purchase a motorbike for commuting to work. By doing so, she will be able to save some money on her transportation expenses to support the family. In the future, she plans to rebuild her present house and support her children's studies until they get Bachelor's degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting to work

loans.name: Narou

texts.fr: Madame Narou  vit sur le territoire sénégalais. Elle est âgée  de 61 ans et s’active depuis 10 ans dans le commerce et la vente de produits divers( foulards, habits et tissus teintés). Elle a choisi son activité dans le souci de se procurer des revenus et subvenir a ses besoins et ainsi qu’a ceux de  sa famille. Elle est membre du guichet de l’U-IMCEC de la localité ou elle habite depuis aout 2005. Elle a déjà bénéficié de 6 crédits antérieurs. Elle sollicite un crédit  de 500 000 frs prévu pour  le dédouanement de ses marchandises.  Les bénéfices que lui génère  son activité lui  ont  permis dans le passé   de régler beaucoup  de problèmes  familiaux.
texts.en:
Ms. Narou lives on Senegalese territory. She is 61 years old and has been active for ten years in commerce selling various goods (scarves, clothing, and dyed fabrics). She chose this business out of concern for acquiring revenues and for supporting herself, as well as her family. 

Since August 2005, Ms. Narou has been a member of the U-IMCEC branch office in the town where she lives. She has already benefited from six previous loans. 

She is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs to clear her merchandise from customs. The profit her business generates has previously enabled her to settle many family problems.

loans.use: to cover the customs fees for her merchandise

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is 52 years old, married with four children. He owns and operates a maize mill machine to earn a living. He has been in the business for 14 years and has employed one person. He earns extra income from poultry farming. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve his living standards and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 22,500 Kenya Shillings to buy a maize mill machine.

loans.use: To buy a maize mill machine.

loans.name: Ndeye Awa

texts.fr: Madame Ndeye Awa habite au Sénégal. Elle est âgée  de 37 ans. Elle a une double activité. Elle s’active dans le secteur de l’aviculture  et pratique en meme temps la vente de produits divers. Elle a choisi ses activités dans le but de se procurer des revenus et faire face a ses besoins personnels ainsi qu’a ceux de sa famille. C’est l’aspect lucratif et la  réalisation de bénéfices qui l’intéresse  surtout. Elle est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis octobre 2010. Elle sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de poussins  pour les besoins de son activité avicole. Son souhait est de développer son activité avicole et accroitre ses bénéfices.
texts.en:
Ms. Ndeye Awa lives in Senegal. She is 37 years old and has two businesses. She is active in the sector of poultry farming and at the same sells a variety of goods. She chose her work with the goal of having an income and coping with her needs, as well as those of her family. The lucrative aspect and profit-making are what interest her in particular. 

Ms. Ndeye Awa has been a member of a U-IMCEC branch office since October 2010. She is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs to buy chicks for her poultry business. Her wish is to develop her poultry business and to increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy chicks to raise

loans.name: Sovan

texts.en:
Sovan, age 42, is a garment worker and her husband, Ratana, age 40, is a fisherman (pictured together). They have been married since 1990 and have two sons and three daughters. Three of the children are garment workers and the others attend school. The family lives in a village about thirty-five kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Sovan is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase additional materials for her husband’s fishing business.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials for her husband’s fishing business.

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.es:
La señora Emiliana es una señora trabajadora  de cincuenta y siete años de edad  se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace tres años.
Esta felizmente  casada con el señor Lucio un señor trabajador con quien tiene dos hijos a quien quiere y por quien trabaja.
Ella pidió el préstamo para la compra de más ropa para la venta..
texts.en:
Mrs. Emiliana is a fifty-seven year old hardworking woman who has sold clothing for three years.

She is happily married to Mr. Lucio, an industrious man with whom she has two children that she loves very much and are the driving force for all of her hard work.

Mrs. Emiliana needs the loan to buy more clothing to sell.

loans.use: buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Sokim

texts.en:
Sokim, 34, is married with three school-aged children. She and her family reside in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. Sokim and her husband have been involved in a successful agricultural business for over five years and have extensive experience growing rice and vegetables to sell. In addition, her husband is a fisherman. 

In order to improve her family economy, Sokim is requesting a loan of USD 800 to begin a new business by purchasing groceries to sell from home. By doing this, she would generate more income to support the family. In the future, she plans to purchase rice to store in a warehouse for resale later when the price is higher. Moreover, she hopes to support her children in their studies until they get their Bachelors' degrees.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell from home.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Touch is a 48-year-old married woman who resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. To earn a living, she has been making dip-nets (used to catch fish) to sell for over three years. Doing this she earns approximately USD 2 per day. Her husband, a construction worker, earns approximately USD 5 per day. Her children are also employed as construction workers. 

In order to improve her family living conditions, Touch is requesting for a loan of USD 800 to begin a new business purchasing groceries to sell from home. By doing this, she would generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business, build a new house and support her children while they study until they get their Bachelors degrees.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell from home.

loans.name: Ana  Iris

texts.es:
La señora Ana  Iris tiene  treinta y dos años de edad, se dedica a la venta  de calzado por catalogo desde hace seis años.
